pli-tv-kd14:0.3.eng: The chapter on the settling of legal issues

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū asammukhībhūtānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kammāni karonti—
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six did legal procedures—

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.3.eng: condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, and ejection—against monks who were absent.
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.3.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “demotion” for niyassa, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū asammukhībhūtānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kammāni karissanti—
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.5.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?”

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.7.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha of monks gathered and questioned them:

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū asammukhībhūtānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kammāni karonti—
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six are doing this?”

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.12.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ moghapurisānaṃ ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.12.eng: “It’s not suitable for those foolish men, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.13.pli: Kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā asammukhībhūtānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kammāni karissanti—

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.17.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.19.pli: tajjanīyaṃ vā, niyassaṃ vā, pabbājanīyaṃ vā, paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā, ukkhepanīyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.19.eng: condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—against monks who are absent.

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.20.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.21.pli: Adhammavādī puggalo adhammavādī sambahulā adhammavādī saṅgho.
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.21.eng: An individual who speaks contrary to the Teaching; several people who speak contrary to the Teaching; a sangha that speaks contrary to the Teaching.

pli-tv-kd14:1.1.22.pli: Dhammavādī puggalo dhammavādī sambahulā dhammavādī saṅgho.
pli-tv-kd14:1.1.22.eng: An individual who speaks in accordance with the Teaching; several people who speak in accordance with the Teaching; a sangha that speaks in accordance with the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove,

pli-tv-kd14:4.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmatā dabbena mallaputtena jātiyā sattavassena arahattaṃ sacchikataṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.2.eng: Venerable Dabba the Mallian realized perfection at the age of seven.

pli-tv-kd14:4.1.3.pli: Yaṃ kiñci sāvakena pattabbaṃ sabbaṃ tena anuppattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.3.eng: He had achieved all there is to achieve by a disciple

pli-tv-kd14:4.1.4.pli: Natthi cassa kiñci uttari karaṇīyaṃ, katassa vā paticayo.
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.4.eng: and had nothing further to do.

pli-tv-kd14:4.1.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—

pli-tv-kd14:4.1.7.pli: Yaṃ kiñci sāvakena pattabbaṃ sabbaṃ mayā anuppattaṃ.

pli-tv-kd14:4.1.8.pli: Natthi ca me kiñci uttarikaraṇīyaṃ, katassa vā paticayo.

pli-tv-kd14:4.1.9.pli: Kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ saṅghassa veyyāvaccaṃ kareyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.9.eng: he thought, “How can I be of service to the Sangha?

pli-tv-kd14:4.1.10.pli: Atha kho āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd14:4.1.11.pli: “yannūnāhaṃ saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapeyyaṃ bhattāni ca uddiseyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.11.eng: Why don’t I assign the dwellings and designate the meals?”

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā dabbo mallaputto sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd14:4.2.1.eng: In the evening Dabba came out of seclusion and went to the Buddha. He bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā dabbo mallaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.3.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd14:4.2.3.eng: “Sir, while I was reflecting in private, it occurred to me that

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.4.eng: I’ve achieved all there is to achieve by a disciple,

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.5.pli: Yaṃ kiñci sāvakena pattabbaṃ, sabbaṃ mayā anuppattaṃ.

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.6.pli: Natthi ca me kiñci uttarikaraṇīyaṃ, katassa vā paticayo.

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.7.pli: Kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ saṅghassa veyyāvaccaṃ kareyyan’ti?
pli-tv-kd14:4.2.7.eng: and I was wondering how I could be of service to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.9.pli: ‘yannūnāhaṃ saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapeyyaṃ bhattāni ca uddiseyyan’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.2.9.eng: ‘Why don’t I assign the dwellings and designate the meals?’”

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.10.pli: Icchāmahaṃ, bhante, saṅghassa senāsanañca paññāpetuṃ bhattāni ca uddisitun”ti.

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.12.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ, dabba, saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapehi bhattāni ca uddisāhī”ti.

pli-tv-kd14:4.2.13.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā dabbo mallaputto bhagavato paccassosi.

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.2.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ senāsanapaññāpakañca bhattuddesakañca sammannatu.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.2.eng: “Monks, the Sangha should appoint Dabba the Mallian as the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals.

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.3.eng: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.5.pli: Yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.5.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.6.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.7.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ senāsanapaññāpakañca bhattuddesakañca sammanneyya.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.7.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint Venerable Dabba the Mallian as the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals.

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.9.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.10.pli: Saṅgho āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ senāsanapaññāpakañca bhattuddesakañca sammannati.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.10.eng: The Sangha appoints Venerable Dabba the Mallian as the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals.

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.11.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa senāsanapaññāpakassa ca bhattuddesakassa ca sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.11.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing Venerable Dabba as the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.12.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.13.pli: Sammato saṅghena āyasmā dabbo mallaputto senāsanapaññāpako ca bhattuddesako ca.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.13.eng: The Sangha has appointed Venerable Dabba the Mallian as the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals.

pli-tv-kd14:4.3.14.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.14.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.1.pli: Sammato ca panāyasmā dabbo mallaputto sabhāgānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.1.eng: Dabba assigned dwellings to the monks according to their character.

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū suttantikā tesaṃ ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.2.eng: He assigned dwellings in the same place to those monks who were experts on the discourse, thinking,

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.3.eng: “They’ll recite the discourses to one another.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū vinayadharā tesaṃ ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.4.eng: And he did likewise for the experts on Monastic Law, thinking,

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū dhammakathikā tesaṃ ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.6.eng: for the expounders of the Teaching, thinking,

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.8.pli: Ye te bhikkhū jhāyino tesaṃ ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū tiracchānakathikā kāyadaḷhibahulā viharanti tesampi ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.10.eng: and for the gossips and the bodybuilders, thinking,

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.11.eng: “In this way even these venerables will be happy.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.12.pli: Yepi te bhikkhū vikāle āgacchanti tesampi tejodhātuṃ samāpajjitvā teneva ālokena senāsanaṃ paññapeti;
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.12.eng: When monks arrived at night, he entered the fire element and assigned dwellings with the help of that light.

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.13.eng: Monks even arrived late on purpose,

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.14.eng: hoping to see the marvel of Dabba’s supernormal powers.

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.15.pli: Te āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.15.eng: They would approach Dabba and say,

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.16.eng: “Venerable Dabba, please assign us a dwelling.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.17.pli: Te āyasmā dabbo mallaputto evaṃ vadeti—

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.19.eng: They would intentionally suggest somewhere far away:

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.20.pli: “amhākaṃ, āvuso dabba, gijjhakūṭe pabbate senāsanaṃ paññapehi.

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.22.pli: Amhākaṃ, āvuso, isigilipasse kāḷasilāyaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapehi.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.22.eng: “On Black Rock on the slope of Mount Isigili,”

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.23.pli: Amhākaṃ, āvuso, vebhārapasse sattapaṇṇiguhāyaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapehi.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.23.eng: “In the Sattapaṇṇi Cave on the slope of Mount Vebhāra,”

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.24.pli: Amhākaṃ, āvuso, sītavane sappasoṇḍikapabbhāre senāsanaṃ paññapehi.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.24.eng: “In Cool Grove on the hill at the Snake’s Pool,”

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.30.pli: Amhākaṃ, āvuso, maddakucchimhi migadāye senāsanaṃ paññapehī”ti.

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.31.pli: Tesaṃ āyasmā dabbo mallaputto tejodhātuṃ samāpajjitvā aṅguliyā jalamānāya purato purato gacchati.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.31.eng: Dabba then entered the fire element, and with his finger glowing, he walked in front of those monks.

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.32.pli: Tepi teneva ālokena āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito gacchanti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.32.eng: They followed behind him with the help of that light.

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.33.pli: Tesaṃ āyasmā dabbo mallaputto evaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.33.eng: And he would assign them dwellings:

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.34.pli: “ayaṃ mañco, idaṃ pīṭhaṃ, ayaṃ bhisi, idaṃ bibbohanaṃ, idaṃ vaccaṭṭhānaṃ, idaṃ passāvaṭṭhānaṃ, idaṃ pānīyaṃ, idaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ, ayaṃ kattaradaṇḍo, idaṃ saṅghassa katikasaṇṭhānaṃ, imaṃ kālaṃ pavisitabbaṃ, imaṃ kālaṃ nikkhamitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.34.eng: “This is the bed, this the bench, this the mattress, this the pillow, this the place for defecating, this the place for urinating, this the water for drinking, this the water for washing, this the walking stick; these are the Sangha’s agreements concerning the right time to enter and the right time to leave.”
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.34.comm: Idaṁ saṅghassa katikasaṇṭhānaṁ, imaṁ kālaṁ pavisitabbaṁ, imaṁ kālaṁ nikkhamitabbanti might be read as “These are the Sangha’s agreements, this is the time to enter, this is the time to leave,” thereby excluding the word “concerning”. In other words, although I have rendered it as such, it is not clear that there is a connection between them. Kd 18:1.2.22, however, makes it clear that the first phrase is to be read in conjunction with the following two.

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.35.pli: Tesaṃ āyasmā dabbo mallaputto evaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapetvā punadeva veḷuvanaṃ paccāgacchati.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.35.eng: Dabba then returned to the Bamboo Grove.

pli-tv-kd14:4.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū navakā ceva honti appapuññā ca.
pli-tv-kd14:4.5.1.eng: At that time the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka were only newly ordained. They had little merit,

pli-tv-kd14:4.5.2.pli: Yāni saṅghassa lāmakāni senāsanāni tāni tesaṃ pāpuṇanti lāmakāni ca bhattāni.

pli-tv-kd14:4.5.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe manussā icchanti therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ abhisaṅkhārikaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ dātuṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:4.5.3.eng: The people of Rājagaha were keen on giving specially prepared almsfood to the senior monks—

pli-tv-kd14:4.5.5.eng: but to the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka they gave ordinary food of

pli-tv-kd14:4.5.7.pli: Te pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā there bhikkhū pucchanti—
pli-tv-kd14:4.5.7.eng: When they had eaten their meal and returned from almsround, they asked the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd14:4.5.8.pli: “tumhākaṃ, āvuso, bhattagge kiṃ ahosi, tumhākaṃ kiṃ ahosī”ti?
pli-tv-kd14:4.5.8.eng: “What did you get at the dining hall?”

pli-tv-kd14:4.5.10.pli: “amhākaṃ, āvuso, sappi ahosi, telaṃ ahosi, uttaribhaṅgaṃ ahosī”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.5.10.eng: “We got ghee, oil, and special curries.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.5.11.eng: But the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka said,

pli-tv-kd14:4.5.13.eng: except ordinary food of porridge and broken rice.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati saṅghassa catukkabhattaṃ deti niccabhattaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:4.6.1.eng: At that time there was a householder who gave a regular meal of fine food to four monks.

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.2.eng: He made his offering in the dining hall together with his wives and children.

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.3.pli: aññe odanena pucchanti, aññe sūpena pucchanti, aññe telena pucchanti, aññe uttaribhaṅgena pucchanti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.6.3.eng: Some of them offered rice, some bean curry, some oil, and some special curries.

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kalyāṇabhattikassa gahapatino bhattaṃ svātanāya mettiyabhūmajakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ uddiṭṭhaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.6.4.eng: On one occasion the meal to be given by this householder on the following day had been designated to the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka.

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.5.pli: Atha kho kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati ārāmaṃ agamāsi kenacideva karaṇīyena.
pli-tv-kd14:4.6.5.eng: Just then that householder went to the monastery on some business.

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.6.pli: So yenāyasmā dabbo mallaputto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd14:4.6.6.eng: He approached Dabba, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.7.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho kalyāṇabhattikaṃ gahapatiṃ āyasmā dabbo mallaputto dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd14:4.6.7.eng: Dabba instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.8.pli: Atha kho kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati āyasmatā dabbena mallaputtena dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd14:4.6.8.eng: After the talk, he asked Dabba,

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.9.pli: “kassa, bhante, amhākaṃ ghare svātanāya bhattaṃ uddiṭṭhan”ti?
pli-tv-kd14:4.6.9.eng: “Sir, who’s been designated to receive tomorrow’s meal in our house?”

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.10.pli: “Mettiyabhūmajakānaṃ kho, gahapati, bhikkhūnaṃ tumhākaṃ ghare svātanāya bhattaṃ uddiṭṭhan”ti.

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.11.pli: Atha kho kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati anattamano ahosi.

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.12.pli: Kathañhi nāma pāpabhikkhū amhākaṃ ghare bhuñjissantīti gharaṃ gantvā dāsiṃ āṇāpesi—
pli-tv-kd14:4.6.12.eng: and thought, “Why should bad monks eat in our house?” After returning to his house, he told a female slave,

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.13.pli: “ye, je, sve bhattikā āgacchanti te koṭṭhake āsanaṃ paññapetvā kaṇājakena bilaṅgadutiyena parivisā”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.6.13.eng: “For those who are coming for tomorrow’s meal, prepare seats in the gatehouse and serve them broken rice and porridge.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.14.pli: “Evaṃ, ayyā”ti kho sā dāsī kalyāṇabhattikassa gahapatino paccassosi.

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.1.eng: The monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka said to each other,

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.2.pli: “hiyyo kho, āvuso, amhākaṃ kalyāṇabhattikassa gahapatino bhattaṃ uddiṭṭhaṃ;
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.2.eng: “Yesterday we were designated a meal from that householder who offers fine food.

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.3.pli: sve amhe kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati saputtadāro upatiṭṭhitvā parivisissati;
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.3.eng: Tomorrow he’ll serve us together with his wives and children.

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.4.pli: aññe odanena pucchissanti, aññe sūpena pucchissanti, aññe telena pucchissanti, aññe uttaribhaṅgena pucchissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.4.eng: Some of them will offer us rice, some bean curry, some oil, and some special curries.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.5.pli: Te teneva somanassena na cittarūpaṃ rattiyā supiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.5.eng: And because they were excited, they did not sleep properly that night.

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.6.pli: Atha kho mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena kalyāṇabhattikassa gahapatino nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.6.eng: The following morning they robed up, took their bowls and robes, and went to the house of that householder.

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.7.pli: Addasā kho sā dāsī mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū dūratova āgacchante;
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.7.eng: When the female slave saw them coming,

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.8.pli: disvāna koṭṭhake āsanaṃ paññapetvā mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.8.eng: she prepared seats in the gatehouse and said to them,

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.11.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho na tāva bhattaṃ siddhaṃ bhavissati yathā mayaṃ koṭṭhake nisīdāpiyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.11.eng: “The meal can’t be ready, since we’re given seats in the gatehouse.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.12.pli: Atha kho sā dāsī kaṇājakena bilaṅgadutiyena upagañchi—
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.12.eng: She then brought them broken rice and porridge and said,

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.14.eng: “But, Sister, we’ve come for the regular meal.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.16.eng: But yesterday I was told by the head of the household

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.17.pli: ‘ye, je, sve bhattikā āgacchanti, te koṭṭhake āsanaṃ paññapetvā kaṇājakena bilaṅgadutiyena parivisā’ti.

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.20.pli: “hiyyo kho, āvuso, kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati ārāmaṃ agamāsi dabbassa mallaputtassa santike.
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.20.eng: “Yesterday this householder came to the monastery and spoke with Dabba.

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.21.pli: Nissaṃsayaṃ kho mayaṃ dabbena mallaputtena gahapatino antare paribhinnā”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.21.eng: Dabba must be responsible for this split between the householder and us.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.22.pli: Te teneva domanassena na cittarūpaṃ bhuñjiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.22.eng: And because they were dejected, they did not eat as much as they had intended.

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.23.pli: Atha kho mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā ārāmaṃ gantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭisāmetvā bahārāmakoṭṭhake saṅghāṭipallatthikāya nisīdiṃsu tuṇhībhūtā maṅkubhūtā pattakkhandhā adhomukhā pajjhāyantā appaṭibhānā.
pli-tv-kd14:4.7.23.eng: When they had eaten their meal and returned from almsround, they put their bowls and robes away, and squatted on their heels outside the monastery gatehouse, using their upper robes as a back-and-knee strap. They were silent and humiliated, with shoulders drooping and heads down, glum and speechless.

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.1.pli: Atha kho mettiyā bhikkhunī yena mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd14:4.8.1.eng: Just then the nun Mettiyā came to them and said,

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.5.pli: tatiyampi kho mettiyā bhikkhunī mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd14:4.8.5.eng: a third time she said the same thing,

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.7.eng: but they still did not respond.

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.10.pli: “Tathā hi pana tvaṃ, bhagini, amhe dabbena mallaputtena viheṭhiyamāne ajjhupekkhasī”ti?
pli-tv-kd14:4.8.10.eng: “It’s because we’ve been badly treated by Dabba the Mallian, and you’re not taking an interest.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.12.pli: “Sace kho tvaṃ, bhagini, iccheyyāsi, ajjeva bhagavā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ nāsāpeyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.8.12.eng: “If you like, you could make the Buddha expel Dabba.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.15.pli: “Ehi tvaṃ, bhagini, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ evaṃ vadehi—

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.16.pli: ‘idaṃ, bhante, nacchannaṃ nappatirūpaṃ, yāyaṃ, bhante, disā abhayā anītikā anupaddavā sāyaṃ disā sabhayā saītikā saupaddavā;
pli-tv-kd14:4.8.16.eng: ‘Sir, this isn’t proper or appropriate. There’s fear, distress, and oppression in this district, where none of these should exist.

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.17.eng: It’s windy where it should be calm.

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.18.eng: It’s as if water is burning.

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.19.eng: Venerable Dabba the Mallian has raped me.’”

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.20.pli: “Evaṃ, ayyā”ti kho mettiyā bhikkhunī mettiyabhūmajakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd14:4.8.20.eng: Saying, “Alright, venerables,” she went to the Buddha, bowed,

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.21.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho mettiyā bhikkhunī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd14:4.8.22.pli: “idaṃ, bhante, nacchannaṃ nappatirūpaṃ, yāyaṃ, bhante, disā abhayā anītikā anupaddavā sāyaṃ disā sabhayā saītikā saupaddavā;
pli-tv-kd14:4.8.22.eng: what she had been told to say.

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Dabba:

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.2.pli: “sarasi tvaṃ, dabba, evarūpaṃ kattā yathāyaṃ bhikkhunī āhā”ti?
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.2.eng: “Dabba, do you remember doing as the nun Mettiyā says?”

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.4.pli: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.5.pli: “sarasi tvaṃ, dabba, evarūpaṃ kattā yathāyaṃ bhikkhunī āhā”ti?

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.7.pli: Tatiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.7.eng: and a third time the Buddha asked

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.8.pli: “sarasi tvaṃ, dabba, evarūpaṃ kattā yathāyaṃ bhikkhunī āhā”ti?

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.10.eng: He then said, “Dabba, the Dabbas don’t give such evasive answers.

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.11.eng: If it was done by you, say so;

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.12.eng: if it wasn’t, then say that.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.13.pli: “Yatohaṃ, bhante, jāto nābhijānāmi supinantenapi methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitā, pageva jāgaro”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.13.eng: “Since I was born, sir, I don’t recall having sexual intercourse even in a dream, let alone when awake.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.15.eng: “Well then, monks, expel the nun Mettiyā,
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.15.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “expel” for nāsetha, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.16.eng: and call these monks to account.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.17.pli: Idaṃ vatvā bhagavā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.17.eng: The Buddha then got up from his seat and entered his dwelling.

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.18.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū mettiyaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nāsesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.18.eng: When the monks had expelled the nun Mettiyā,

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.19.pli: Atha kho mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū te bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.19.eng: the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka said to them,

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.20.pli: “māvuso, mettiyaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nāsetha, na sā kiñci aparajjhati;
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.20.eng: “Don’t expel the nun Mettiyā; she hasn’t done anything wrong.

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.21.pli: amhehi sā ussāhitā kupitehi anattamanehi cāvanādhippāyehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.21.eng: She was urged on by us. We were angry and displeased, and trying to make Dabba give up the monastic life.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.22.pli: “Kiṃ pana tumhe, āvuso, āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsethā”ti?
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.22.eng: “But did you groundlessly charge Venerable Dabba with failure in morality?”

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.24.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.24.eng: The monks of few desires … complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.25.pli: “kathañhi nāma mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.25.eng: “How could the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka groundlessly charge Venerable Dabba with failure in morality?”

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.26.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.27.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsentī”ti?
pli-tv-kd14:4.9.27.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-kd14:4.9.30.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.1.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho dabbassa mallaputtassa sativepullappattassa sativinayaṃ detu.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.1.eng: “Well then, because of his great clarity of memory, grant resolution through recollection to Dabba the Mallian.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.2.eng: And it should be granted like this.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.3.pli: tena, bhikkhave, dabbena mallaputtena saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā, ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā, vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā, ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā, añjaliṃ paggahetvā, evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.3.eng: Dabba should approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.4.pli: ‘ime maṃ, bhante, mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsenti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.4.eng: ‘Venerables, these monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka are groundlessly charging me with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.5.pli: Sohaṃ, bhante, sativepullappatto saṅghaṃ sativinayaṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.5.eng: Because of my great clarity of memory, I ask the Sangha for resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.6.eng: Venerables, these monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka are groundlessly charging me with failure in morality. Because of my great clarity of memory, for the second time, I ask the Sangha for resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.8.pli: ‘ime maṃ, bhante, mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsenti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.8.eng: Venerables, these monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka are groundlessly charging me with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.9.pli: Sohaṃ sativepullappatto tatiyampi, bhante, saṅghaṃ sativinayaṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.9.eng: Because of my great clarity of memory, for the third time, I ask the Sangha for resolution through recollection.’

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.10.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.11.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.12.pli: Ime mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsenti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.12.eng: These monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka are groundlessly charging Venerable Dabba the Mallian with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.13.pli: Āyasmā dabbo mallaputto sativepullappatto saṅghaṃ sativinayaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.13.eng: Because of his great clarity of memory, Dabba is asking the Sangha for resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.14.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa sativepullappattassa sativinayaṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.14.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should grant Dabba resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.16.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.17.pli: Ime mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsenti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.17.eng: These monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka are groundlessly charging Venerable Dabba the Mallian with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.18.pli: Āyasmā dabbo mallaputto sativepullappatto saṅghaṃ sativinayaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.18.eng: Because of his great clarity of memory, Dabba is asking the Sangha for resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.19.pli: Saṅgho āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa sativepullappattassa sativinayaṃ deti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.19.eng: The Sangha grants Dabba resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.20.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa sativepullappattassa sativinayassa dānaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.20.eng: Any monk who approves of granting Dabba resolution through recollection should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.21.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.22.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.23.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.24.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.25.pli: Ime mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsenti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.25.eng: These monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka are groundlessly charging Venerable Dabba the Mallian with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.26.pli: Āyasmā dabbo mallaputto sativepullappatto saṅghaṃ sativinayaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.26.eng: Because of his great clarity of memory, Dabba is asking the Sangha for resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.27.pli: Saṅgho āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa sativepullappattassa sativinayaṃ deti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.27.eng: The Sangha grants Dabba resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.28.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa sativepullappattassa sativinayassa dānaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.28.eng: Any monk who approves of granting Dabba resolution through recollection should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.29.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.30.pli: Dinno saṅghena āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa sativepullappattassa sativinayo.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.30.eng: Because of his great clarity of memory, the Sangha has granted Dabba the Mallian resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:4.10.31.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:4.10.31.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd14:4.11.1.eng: There are five factors for the legitimate granting of resolution through recollection:

pli-tv-kd14:4.11.2.pli: Suddho hoti bhikkhu anāpattiko, anuvadanti ca naṃ, yācati ca, tassa saṅgho sativinayaṃ deti dhammena samaggena—
pli-tv-kd14:4.11.2.eng: the monk is pure and free of offenses; he has been accused; he asks for resolution through recollection; the Sangha grants him resolution through recollection; the legal procedure is legitimate and done by a unanimous assembly.”
pli-tv-kd14:4.11.2.comm: Sp 4.195: Tattha ca anuvadantīti codenti, “And there anuvadanti means they accuse.”

pli-tv-kd14:4.11.3.pli: imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammikāni sativinayassa dānānī”ti.

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena gaggo bhikkhu ummattako hoti, cittavipariyāsakato.
pli-tv-kd14:5.1.1.eng: At one time the monk Gagga was insane and suffering from psychosis.
pli-tv-kd14:5.1.1.comm: Cittavipariyāsakata, literally, “(his) mind was made distorted”.

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.2.pli: Tena ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ hoti bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:5.1.2.eng: Because of this, he did and said many things unworthy of a monastic.

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.3.pli: Bhikkhū gaggaṃ bhikkhuṃ ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena ajjhāciṇṇena āpattiyā codenti—
pli-tv-kd14:5.1.3.eng: The monks accused him of an offense, saying,

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.4.eng: “Venerable, do you remember committing such-and-such an offense?”

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.6.eng: “I was insane and suffering from psychosis.

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.7.pli: Tena me ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:5.1.7.eng: Because of that, I did and said many things unworthy of a monastic.

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.9.eng: I did it because I was insane.”

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.10.eng: But they kept on accusing him

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.12.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd14:5.1.12.eng: The monks of few desires … complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū gaggaṃ bhikkhuṃ ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena ajjhāciṇṇena āpattiyā codessanti—
pli-tv-kd14:5.1.13.eng: “How can these monks keep on accusing Gagga

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.17.pli: Tena me ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.22.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.23.eng: He said, “Is it true, monks, that these monks are doing this?”

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.26.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd14:5.1.27.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho gaggassa bhikkhuno amūḷhassa amūḷhavinayaṃ detu.
pli-tv-kd14:5.1.27.eng: “Well then, since he’s no longer insane, grant the monk Gagga resolution because of past insanity.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.1.eng: And it should be granted like this.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.2.pli: tena, bhikkhave, gaggena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā, ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā, vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā, ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā, añjaliṃ paggahetvā, evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.2.eng: The monk Gagga should approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.3.eng: ‘Venerables, I’ve been insane and suffering from psychosis.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.4.pli: Tena me ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.4.eng: Because of that, I did and said many things unworthy of a monastic.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.5.pli: Maṃ bhikkhū ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena ajjhāciṇṇena āpattiyā codenti—
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.5.eng: The monks accused me of an offense, saying,

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.6.eng: “Venerable, do you remember committing such-and-such an offense?”

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.8.eng: “I was insane and suffering from psychosis.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.9.pli: Tena me ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.9.eng: Because of that, I did and said many things unworthy of a monastic.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.11.eng: I did it because I was insane.”

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.12.eng: But they kept on accusing me

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.14.pli: Sohaṃ, bhante, amūḷho saṅghaṃ amūḷhavinayaṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.14.eng: Because I’m no longer insane, I ask the Sangha for resolution because of past insanity.’

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.15.eng: And he should ask a second time,

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.17.eng: ‘Venerables, I’ve been insane and suffering from psychosis.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.18.pli: Tena me ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.18.eng: Because of that, I did and said many things unworthy of a monastic.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.19.pli: Maṃ bhikkhū ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena ajjhāciṇṇena āpattiyā codenti—
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.19.eng: The monks accused me of an offense, saying,

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.20.eng: “Venerable, do you remember committing such-and-such an offense?”

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.22.eng: “I was insane and suffering from psychosis.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.23.pli: Tena me ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.23.eng: Because of that, I did and said many things unworthy of a monastic.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.24.pli: Nāhaṃ taṃ sarāmi mūḷhena me etaṃ katan”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.24.eng: I don’t remember it. I did it because I was insane.”

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.25.eng: But they kept on accusing me

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.27.pli: Sohaṃ amūḷho tatiyampi, bhante, saṅghaṃ amūḷhavinayaṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.27.eng: Because I’m no longer insane, for the third time, I ask the Sangha for resolution because of past insanity.’

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.28.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.29.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.30.pli: Ayaṃ gaggo bhikkhu ummattako ahosi cittavipariyāsakato.
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.30.eng: The monk Gagga has been insane and suffering from psychosis.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.31.pli: Tena ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.31.eng: Because of that, he did and said many things unworthy of a monastic.

pli-tv-kd14:5.2.32.pli: Bhikkhū gaggaṃ bhikkhuṃ ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena ajjhāciṇṇena āpattiyā codenti—
pli-tv-kd14:5.2.32.eng: The monks accused him of an offense, saying,

pli-tv-kd14:10.1.1.pli: Dasayime, bhikkhave, adhammikā salākaggāhā, dasa dhammikā.
pli-tv-kd14:10.1.1.eng: There are ten reasons why a vote is illegitimate:

pli-tv-kd14:10.1.3.pli: Oramattakañca adhikaraṇaṃ hoti, na ca gatigataṃ hoti, na ca saritasāritaṃ hoti, jānāti adhammavādī bahutarāti, appeva nāma adhammavādī bahutarā assūti, jānāti saṅgho bhijjissatīti, appeva nāma saṅgho bhijjeyyāti, adhammena gaṇhanti, vaggā gaṇhanti, na ca yathādiṭṭhiyā gaṇhanti—
pli-tv-kd14:10.1.3.eng: it’s only a minor legal issue; the full process for settling it hasn’t run its course; they haven’t tried to remember offenses and remind about offenses; the manager knows that those who speak contrary to the Teaching are in the majority; the manager expects that those who speak contrary to the Teaching will be in the majority; the manager knows that the Sangha will split; the manager expects that the Sangha will split; they vote illegitimately; they vote with an incomplete assembly; they don’t vote according to their own views.
pli-tv-kd14:10.1.3.comm: Sp 4.204: Na ca gatigatanti dve tayo āvāse na gataṁ, tattha tattheva vā dvattikkhattuṁ avinicchitaṁ, “Na ca gatigatan: they have not gone to two or three monasteries, or they have not investigated two or three times in this or that place.” Sp 4.204: Na ca saritasāritanti dvattikkhattuṁ tehi bhikkhūhi sayaṁ saritaṁ vā aññehi sāritaṁ vā na hoti, “Na ca saritasāritan: Those monks have not themselves remembered or had others remember two or three times.” In regard to the verb jānāti, “knows”, it is not immediately clear who the agent is. I translate in accordance with the commentary, which specifies that it is the manager of the vote. Sp 4.204: Jānātīti salākaṁ gāhento jānāti “adhammavādī bahutarā”ti, “Jānāti: the one distributing the ballots (i.e. the manager) knows that those speaking contrary to the Teaching are in the majority.”

pli-tv-kd14:10.2.1.eng: And there are ten reasons why a vote is legitimate:

pli-tv-kd14:10.2.2.pli: Na ca oramattakaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti, gatigatañca hoti, saritasāritañca hoti, jānāti dhammavādī bahutarāti, appeva nāma dhammavādī bahutarā assūti, jānāti saṅgho na bhijjissatīti, appeva nāma saṅgho na bhijjeyyāti, dhammena gaṇhanti, samaggā gaṇhanti, yathādiṭṭhiyā ca gaṇhanti—
pli-tv-kd14:10.2.2.eng: it’s not a minor legal issue; the full process for settling it has run its course; they’ve tried to remember offenses and remind about offenses; the manager knows that those who speak in accordance with the Teaching are in the majority; the manager expects that those who speak in accordance with the Teaching will be in the majority; the manager knows that the Sangha won’t split; the manager expects that the Sangha won’t split; they vote legitimately; they vote with a complete assembly; they vote according to their own views.”

pli-tv-kd14:11.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena upavāḷo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjiyamāno avajānitvā paṭijānāti, paṭijānitvā avajānāti, aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, sampajānamusā bhāsati.
pli-tv-kd14:11.1.1.eng: On one occasion, when the monk Upavāḷa was being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an offense, he asserted things after denying them, denied things after asserting them, evaded the issue, and lied.

pli-tv-kd14:11.1.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd14:11.1.2.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd14:11.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma upavāḷo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjiyamāno avajānitvā paṭijānissati, paṭijānitvā avajānissati, aññenaññaṃ paṭicarissati, sampajānamusā bhāsissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:11.1.3.eng: “How can the monk Upavāḷa act like this?”

pli-tv-kd14:11.1.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd14:11.1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monk Upavāḷa is acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd14:11.1.8.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd14:11.1.9.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho upavāḷassa bhikkhuno tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ karotu.
pli-tv-kd14:11.1.9.eng: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of further penalty against the monk Upavāḷa.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.1.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.2.pli: Paṭhamaṃ upavāḷo bhikkhu codetabbo, codetvā sāretabbo, sāretvā āpattiṃ āropetabbo, āpattiṃ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd14:11.2.2.eng: First you should accuse the monk Upavāḷa. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he’s charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.4.pli: Ayaṃ upavāḷo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjiyamāno avajānitvā paṭijānāti, paṭijānitvā avajānāti, aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, sampajānamusā bhāsati.
pli-tv-kd14:11.2.4.eng: The monk Upavāḷa, while being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an offense, asserted things after denying them, denied things after asserting them, evaded the issue, and lied.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.5.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho upavāḷassa bhikkhuno tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd14:11.2.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do a legal procedure of further penalty against him.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.7.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.8.pli: Ayaṃ upavāḷo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjiyamāno avajānitvā paṭijānāti, paṭijānitvā avajānāti, aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, sampajānamusā bhāsati.
pli-tv-kd14:11.2.8.eng: The monk Upavāḷa, while being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an offense, asserted things after denying them, denied things after asserting them, evaded the issue, and lied.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.9.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of further penalty against him.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.10.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati upavāḷassa bhikkhuno tassapāpiyasikākammassa karaṇaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd14:11.2.10.eng: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of further penalty against him should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.11.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.12.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.13.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.14.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of further penalty against the monk Upavāḷa.

pli-tv-kd14:11.2.15.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:11.2.15.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd14:12.1.1.eng: There are these five factors of a legitimate legal procedure of further penalty:

pli-tv-kd14:12.1.2.pli: Asuci ca hoti, alajjī ca, sānuvādo ca, tassa saṅgho tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ karoti dhammena, samaggena—
pli-tv-kd14:12.1.2.eng: the subject of the procedure is impure; he’s shameless; he has been accused; the procedure is legitimate; the procedure is done by a unanimous assembly.”

pli-tv-kd14:12.1.3.pli: imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammikāni tassapāpiyasikākammassa karaṇāni.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.0.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd14:12.2.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of further penalty has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.1.pli: Asammukhā kataṃ hoti, appaṭipucchākataṃ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.1.eng: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.2.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.3.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.4.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.5.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.6.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done without the admission of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.7.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.8.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.9.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.10.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.2.11.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.3.pli: … adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd14:12.2.3.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it’s done without having charged the person with their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.”

pli-tv-kd14:12.2.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.0.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd14:12.3.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of further penalty has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.1.pli: Sammukhā kataṃ hoti, paṭipucchākataṃ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.1.eng: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done with the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.2.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.3.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done after having accused the person of their offense, it’s done after having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done after having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.4.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.5.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.6.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done with the admission of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.7.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.8.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.9.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.10.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done after having accused the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.11.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done after having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.3.pli: … dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd14:12.3.3.eng: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it’s done after having charged the person with their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.”

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.0.eng: The group of six on wishing

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.1.eng: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of further penalty against him:

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.2.pli: Bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.2.eng: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.3.eng: he’s ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.4.eng: he’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.5.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.6.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.6.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.7.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.7.eng: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.9.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.10.pli: buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.10.eng: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.11.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.12.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.12.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against three kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.14.eng: and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.15.pli: eko bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.15.eng: those who are ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.16.eng: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.17.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.18.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.18.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.19.pli: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.19.eng: those who’ve failed in the higher morality; those who’ve failed in the higher conduct; those who’ve failed in view.

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.21.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.22.pli: eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.22.eng: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.23.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.1.eng: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of further penalty done against himself should conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.3.eng: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.5.eng: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.6.eng: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.1.eng: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.2.eng: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of further penalty against him.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.3.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of further penalty against him.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.4.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of further penalty against him.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.6.eng: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.7.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.8.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.9.eng: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.10.eng: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.11.eng: He shouldn’t ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.12.eng: He shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.13.eng: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.8.eng: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd14:12.6.1.pli: Atha kho saṅgho upavāḷassa bhikkhuno tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-kd14:12.6.1.eng: The Sangha then did a legal procedure of further penalty against the monk Upavāḷa.

pli-tv-kd14:13.1.0.eng: 7. Covering over as if with grass

pli-tv-kd14:13.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ hoti bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.1.eng: At one time, while the monks were arguing and disputing, they did and said many things unworthy of monastics.

pli-tv-kd14:13.1.3.pli: “amhākaṃ kho bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.

pli-tv-kd14:13.1.4.pli: Sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññamaññaṃ kāressāma, siyāpi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.4.eng: “If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism.

pli-tv-kd14:13.1.5.eng: So what should we do now?”

pli-tv-kd14:13.1.7.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ hoti bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.7.eng: “It may be, monks, that monks who are arguing and disputing do and say many things unworthy of monastics.

pli-tv-kd14:13.1.8.eng: If they consider this and think,

pli-tv-kd14:13.1.9.pli: ‘amhākaṃ kho bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ;

pli-tv-kd14:13.1.10.pli: sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññamaññaṃ kāressāma, siyāpi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyyā’ti, anujānāmi, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ tiṇavatthārakena vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.10.eng: ‘If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism,’ then I allow you to resolve that legal issue by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-kd14:13.2.1.eng: And it should be resolved like this.

pli-tv-kd14:13.2.2.pli: Sabbeheva ekajjhaṃ sannipatitabbaṃ, sannipatitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.2.eng: Everyone should gather in one place. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:13.2.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:13.2.4.pli: Amhākaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.4.eng: While we were arguing and disputing, we did and said many things unworthy of monastics.

pli-tv-kd14:13.2.5.pli: Sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññamaññaṃ kāressāma, siyāpi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.5.eng: If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism.

pli-tv-kd14:13.2.6.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ tiṇavatthārakena vūpasameyya, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttan’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.6.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should resolve this legal issue by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.’

pli-tv-kd14:13.2.7.eng: The monks belonging to one side should then be informed by a competent and capable monk belonging to their own side:

pli-tv-kd14:13.2.8.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:13.2.11.eng: If the venerables are ready, then for your benefit and for my own, I’ll confess in the midst of the Sangha both your and my own offenses by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.’

pli-tv-kd14:13.2.12.eng: And the monks belonging to the other side should be informed by a competent and capable monk belonging to their own side:

pli-tv-kd14:13.3.1.eng: A competent and capable monk belonging to one side should then inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd14:13.3.1.comm: I here follow the PTS reading, ekatopakkhikānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, as opposed to the MS reading, athāparesaṁ ekatopakkhikānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ. With the MS reading there is no distinction between the two groups of monks.

pli-tv-kd14:13.3.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, then for the benefit of these venerables and myself, I’ll confess in the midst of the Sangha both their and my own offenses by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.

pli-tv-kd14:13.3.7.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:13.3.10.eng: For the benefit of these venerables and myself, I confess in the midst of the Sangha both their and my own offenses by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.

pli-tv-kd14:13.3.11.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati amhākaṃ imāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ saṅghamajjhe tiṇavatthārakena desanā, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd14:13.3.11.eng: Any monk who approves of confessing our offenses in the midst of the Sangha by covering over as if with grass should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd14:13.3.12.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:13.3.13.pli: Desitā amhākaṃ imā āpattiyo saṅghamajjhe tiṇavatthārakena, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:13.3.13.eng: We have confessed our offenses in the midst of the Sangha by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.

pli-tv-kd14:13.3.14.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:13.3.14.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd14:13.4.1.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, te bhikkhū tāhi āpattīhi vuṭṭhitā honti, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ, ṭhapetvā diṭṭhāvikammaṃ, ṭhapetvā ye na tattha hontī”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:13.4.1.eng: In this way those monks are cleared of those offenses, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders, and except for those monks who voice their disapproval and those who are absent.”
pli-tv-kd14:13.4.1.comm: “Voice their disapproval” renders diṭṭhāvikamma, literally, “disclosure of view”. This cannot mean an objection made in the midst of the Sangha, for that would invalidate the procedure. Sp 4.214: Ye pana “na metaṁ khamatī”ti aññamaññaṁ diṭṭhāvikammaṁ karonti … te āpattīhi na vuṭṭhahanti, “But those who disclose their view to each other, saying, ‘I do not approve of this’ … they are not cleared of offenses.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhūpi bhikkhūhi vivadanti, bhikkhūpi bhikkhunīhi vivadanti, bhikkhuniyopi bhikkhūhi vivadanti, channopi bhikkhu bhikkhunīnaṃ anupakhajja bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ vivadati, bhikkhunīnaṃ pakkhaṃ gāheti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.1.eng: On one occasion monks were disputing with monks, monks with nuns, and nuns with monks. Standing with the nuns, the monk Channa disputed with the monks, making others side with the nuns.
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.1.comm: Bhikkhunīnaṁ anupakhajja, literally, “intruding on the nuns”. Sp 4.215: Bhikkhunīnaṁ anupakhajjāti bhikkhunīnaṁ anto pavisitvā, “Intruding on the nuns means having entered among the nuns.” The contextual point is that he is siding with the nuns.

pli-tv-kd14:14.1.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.2.eng: The monks of few desires … complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd14:14.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma channo bhikkhu bhikkhunīnaṃ anupakhajja bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ vivadissati, bhikkhunīnaṃ pakkhaṃ gāhessatīti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.3.eng: “How can the monk Channa act like this?”

pli-tv-kd14:14.1.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd14:14.1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monk Channa is acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd14:14.1.8.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.1.pli: “Cattārimāni, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇāni— vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.1.eng: “Monks, there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes; legal issues arising from accusations; legal issues arising from offenses; legal issues arising from business.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.2.eng: “What’s a legal issue arising from a dispute?

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.3.eng: It may be that the monks are disputing, saying,

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.4.pli: dhammoti vā adhammoti vā, vinayoti vā avinayoti vā, bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti vā abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti vā, āciṇṇaṃ tathāgatenāti vā anāciṇṇaṃ tathāgatenāti vā, paññattaṃ tathāgatenāti vā apaññattaṃ tathāgatenāti vā, āpattīti vā anāpattīti vā, lahukā āpattīti vā garukā āpattīti vā, sāvasesā āpattīti vā anavasesā āpattīti vā, duṭṭhullā āpattīti vā aduṭṭhullā āpattīti vā?
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.4.eng: ‘This is the Teaching’, ‘This is contrary to the Teaching’, ‘This is the Monastic Law’, ‘This is contrary to the Monastic Law’, ‘This was spoken by the Buddha’, ‘This wasn’t spoken by the Buddha’, ‘This was practiced by the Buddha’, ‘This wasn’t practiced by the Buddha’, ‘This was laid down by the Buddha’, ‘This wasn’t laid down by the Buddha’, ‘This is an offense’, ‘This isn’t an offense’, ‘This is a light offense’, ‘This is a heavy offense’, ‘This is a curable offense’, ‘This is an incurable offense’, ‘This is a grave offense’, or ‘This is a minor offense.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.5.pli: Yaṃ tattha bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo nānāvādo aññathāvādo vipaccatāya vohāro medhagaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.5.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of quarreling, arguing, conflict, disputing, variety in opinion, difference in opinion, heated speech, or strife—

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.6.eng: this is called a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.7.eng: What’s a legal issue arising from an accusation?

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.8.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ anuvadanti sīlavipattiyā vā ācāravipattiyā vā diṭṭhivipattiyā vā ājīvavipattiyā vā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.8.eng: It may be that the monks accuse a monk of failure in morality, failure in conduct, failure in view, or failure in livelihood.

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.9.pli: Yo tattha anuvādo anuvadanā anullapanā anubhaṇanā anusampavaṅkatā abbhussahanatā anubalappadānaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.9.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of accusations, accusing, allegations, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation—

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.10.eng: this is called a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.11.eng: What’s a legal issue arising from an offense?

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.12.pli: Pañcapi āpattikkhandhā āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, sattapi āpattikkhandhā āpattādhikaraṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.12.eng: There are legal issues arising from offenses because of the five classes of offenses; there are legal issues arising from offenses because of the seven classes of offenses—

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.13.eng: this is called a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.14.eng: What’s a legal issue arising from business?

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.15.pli: Yā saṅghassa kiccayatā, karaṇīyatā, apalokanakammaṃ, ñattikammaṃ, ñattidutiyakammaṃ, ñatticatutthakammaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.15.eng: Whatever is the duty or the business of the Sangha—a legal procedure consisting of getting permission, a legal procedure consisting of one motion, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—

pli-tv-kd14:14.2.16.eng: this is called a legal issue arising from business.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.3.0.eng: The roots of legal issues arising from disputes

pli-tv-kd14:14.3.1.eng: “What’s the root of legal issues arising from disputes?

pli-tv-kd14:14.3.2.eng: There are six roots of disputes that in turn are the root of legal issues arising from disputes.

pli-tv-kd14:14.3.3.pli: Tīṇipi akusalamūlāni vivādādhikaraṇassa mūlaṃ, tīṇipi kusalamūlāni vivādādhikaraṇassa mūlaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.3.eng: There are also three unwholesome and three wholesome roots of legal issues arising from disputes.

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.0.eng: Ethical qualities of legal issues arising from disputes

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.1.eng: “Is a legal issue arising from a dispute wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?
pli-tv-kd14:14.8.1.comm: According to the sub-commentary, the Pali should be understood as a question. Sp-ṭ 4.220: Vivādādhikaraṇaṁ kusalaṁ akusalaṁ abyākatanti vivādādhikaraṇaṁ kiṁ kusalaṁ akusalaṁ udāhu abyākatanti pucchati. Vivādādhikaraṇaṁ siyā kusalantiādi vissajjanaṁ. Esa nayo sesesupi, “Vivādādhikaraṇaṁ kusalaṁ akusalaṁ abyākatan: he asks, ‘Is a legal issue arising from a dispute wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?’ ‘A legal issue arising from a dispute may be wholesome,’ etc., is the response. This method also applies to the rest (below).”

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.2.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ siyā kusalaṃ, siyā akusalaṃ, siyā abyākataṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.8.2.eng: A legal issue arising from a dispute may be wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.3.eng: What’s a wholesome legal issue arising from a dispute?

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhū kusalacittā vivadanti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.8.4.eng: It may be that monks dispute with a wholesome mind, saying,

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.5.eng: ‘This is the Teaching’, ‘This is contrary to the Teaching’ …

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.6.pli: duṭṭhullā āpattīti vā aduṭṭhullā āpattīti vā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.8.6.eng: ‘This is a grave offense’, or ‘This is a minor offense.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.7.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of quarreling, arguing, conflict, disputing, variety in opinion, difference in opinion, heated speech, or strife—

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.8.eng: this is called a wholesome legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.9.eng: What’s an unwholesome legal issue arising from a dispute?

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.20.eng: this is called an indeterminate legal issue arising from a dispute.”
