pli-tv-kd14:14.9.1.eng: “Is a legal issue arising from an accusation wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.2.pli: Anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ siyā kusalaṃ, siyā akusalaṃ, siyā abyākataṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.2.eng: A legal issue arising from an accusation may be wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.3.eng: What’s a wholesome legal issue arising from an accusation?

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ kusalacittā anuvadanti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.4.eng: It may be that monks with wholesome minds accuse a monk

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.5.pli: sīlavipattiyā vā, ācāravipattiyā vā, diṭṭhivipattiyā vā, ājīvavipattiyā vā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.5.eng: of failure in morality, conduct, view, or livelihood.

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.6.pli: Yo tattha anuvādo anuvadanā anullapanā anubhaṇanā anusampavaṅkatā abbhussahanatā anubalappadānaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.6.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of accusations, accusing, allegations, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation—

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.7.eng: this is called a wholesome legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.8.eng: What’s an unwholesome legal issue arising from an accusation?

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.9.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ akusalacittā anuvadanti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.9.eng: It may be that monks with unwholesome minds accuse a monk

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.10.pli: sīlavipattiyā vā, ācāravipattiyā vā, diṭṭhivipattiyā vā, ājīvavipattiyā vā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.10.eng: of failure in morality,  conduct, view, or livelihood.

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.11.pli: Yo tattha anuvādo anuvadanā anullapanā anubhaṇanā anusampavaṅkatā abbhussahanatā anubalappadānaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.11.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of accusations, accusing, allegations, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation—

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.12.eng: this is called an unwholesome legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.13.eng: What’s an indeterminate legal issue arising from an accusation?

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.14.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ abyākatacittā anuvadanti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.14.eng: It may be that monks with indeterminate minds accuse a monk

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.15.pli: sīlavipattiyā vā, ācāravipattiyā vā, diṭṭhivipattiyā vā, ājīvavipattiyā vā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.15.eng: of failure in morality, conduct, view, or livelihood.

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.16.pli: Yo tattha anuvādo anuvadanā anullapanā anubhaṇanā anusampavaṅkatā abbhussahanatā anubalappadānaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.16.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of accusations, accusing, allegations, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation—

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.17.eng: this is called an indeterminate legal issue arising from an accusation.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.18.eng: “Is a legal issue arising from an offense wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?

pli-tv-kd14:14.10.0.eng: Ethical qualities of legal issues arising from offenses

pli-tv-kd14:14.10.1.eng: A legal issue arising from an offense may be unwholesome or indeterminate.

pli-tv-kd14:14.10.2.eng: There are no wholesome legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-kd14:14.10.3.eng: What’s an unwholesome legal issue arising from an offense?

pli-tv-kd14:14.10.4.pli: Yaṃ jānanto sañjānanto cecca abhivitaritvā vītikkamo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.10.4.eng: When one transgresses, knowing, perceiving, having intended, having decided—

pli-tv-kd14:14.10.5.eng: this is called an unwholesome legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-kd14:14.10.6.eng: What’s an indeterminate legal issue arising from an offense?

pli-tv-kd14:14.10.7.pli: Yaṃ ajānanto asañjānanto acecca anabhivitaritvā vītikkamo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.10.7.eng: When one transgresses, not knowing, not perceiving, not having intended, not having decided—

pli-tv-kd14:14.10.8.eng: this is called an indeterminate legal issue arising from an offense.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.0.eng: Ethical qualities of legal issues arising from business

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.1.eng: “Is a legal issue arising from business wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.2.pli: Kiccādhikaraṇaṃ siyā kusalaṃ, siyā akusalaṃ, siyā abyākataṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.2.eng: A legal issue arising from business may be wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.3.eng: What’s a wholesome legal issue arising from business?

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.4.eng: When the Sangha does a legal procedure with a wholesome mind—

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.5.eng: whether a procedure consisting of getting permission, a procedure consisting of one motion, a procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, or a procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.6.eng: this is called a wholesome legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.7.eng: What’s an unwholesome legal issue arising from business?

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.8.eng: When the Sangha does a legal procedure with an unwholesome mind—

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.9.eng: whether a procedure consisting of getting permission, a procedure consisting of one motion, a procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, or a procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.10.eng: this is called an unwholesome legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.11.eng: What’s an indeterminate legal issue arising from business?

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.12.eng: When the Sangha does a legal procedure with an indeterminate mind—

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.13.eng: whether a procedure consisting of getting permission, a procedure consisting of one motion, a procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, or a procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.14.eng: this is called an indeterminate legal issue arising from business.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.0.eng: Relationship between disputes and legal issues

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.1.pli: Vivādo vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, vivādo no adhikaraṇaṃ, adhikaraṇaṃ no vivādo, adhikaraṇañceva vivādo ca.
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.1.eng: “Are there disputes that are also legal issues arising from a dispute? Are there disputes that aren’t also legal issues? Are there legal issues that aren’t also disputes? Are there legal issues that are also disputes?

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.2.pli: Siyā vivādo vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, siyā vivādo no adhikaraṇaṃ, siyā adhikaraṇaṃ no vivādo, siyā adhikaraṇañceva vivādo ca.
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.2.eng: There are disputes that are also legal issues arising from a dispute. There are disputes that aren’t also legal issues. There are legal issues that aren’t also disputes. There are legal issues that are also disputes.

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.3.eng: How’s there a dispute that’s also a legal issue arising from a dispute?

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.4.eng: It may be that monks are disputing, saying,

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.5.eng: ‘This is the Teaching’, ‘This is contrary to the Teaching’ …

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.6.pli: duṭṭhullā āpattīti vā aduṭṭhullā āpattīti vā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.6.eng: ‘This is a grave offense’, or ‘This is a minor offense.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.7.pli: Yaṃ tattha bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo nānāvādo aññathāvādo vipaccatāya vohāro medhagaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.7.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of quarreling, arguing, conflict, disputing, variety in opinion, difference in opinion, heated speech, or strife—

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.8.eng: this is a dispute that’s also a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.9.eng: How’s there a dispute that isn’t also a legal issue?

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.10.pli: Mātāpi puttena vivadati, puttopi mātarā vivadati, pitāpi puttena vivadati, puttopi pitarā vivadati, bhātāpi bhātarā vivadati, bhātāpi bhaginiyā vivadati, bhaginīpi bhātarā vivadati, sahāyopi sahāyena vivadati—
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.10.eng: A mother disputes with her offspring; an offspring with their mother; a father with his offspring; an offspring with their father; a brother with his brother; a brother with his sister; a sister with her brother; a friend with their friend—

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.11.eng: this is a dispute that isn’t also a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.12.eng: How’s there a legal issue that isn’t also a dispute?

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.13.eng: A legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business—

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.14.eng: this is a legal issue that isn’t also a dispute.

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.15.eng: How’s there a legal issue that’s also a dispute?

pli-tv-kd14:14.12.16.eng: A legal issue arising from a dispute is a legal issue and also a dispute.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.0.eng: Relationship between accusations and legal issues

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.1.pli: Anuvādo anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, anuvādo no adhikaraṇaṃ, adhikaraṇaṃ no anuvādo, adhikaraṇañceva anuvādo ca.
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.1.eng: “Are there accusations that are also legal issues arising from accusations? Are there accusations that aren’t also legal issues? Are there legal issues that aren’t also accusations? Are there legal issues that are also accusations?

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.2.pli: Siyā anuvādo anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, siyā anuvādo no adhikaraṇaṃ, siyā adhikaraṇaṃ no anuvādo, siyā adhikaraṇañceva anuvādo ca.
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.2.eng: There are accusations that are also legal issues arising from accusations. There are accusations that aren’t also legal issues. There are legal issues that aren’t also accusations. There are legal issues that are also accusations.

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.3.eng: How’s there an accusation that’s also a legal issue arising from an accusation?

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ anuvadanti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.4.eng: It may be that monks accuse a monk

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.5.pli: sīlavipattiyā vā, ācāravipattiyā vā, diṭṭhivipattiyā vā, ājīvavipattiyā vā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.5.eng: of failure in morality, conduct, view, or livelihood.

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.6.pli: Yo tattha anuvādo anuvadanā anullapanā anubhaṇanā anusampavaṅkatā abbhussahanatā anubalappadānaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.6.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of accusations, accusing, allegations, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation—

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.7.eng: this is an accusation that’s also a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.8.eng: How’s there an accusation that isn’t also a legal issue?

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.9.pli: Mātāpi puttaṃ anuvadati, puttopi mātaraṃ anuvadati, pitāpi puttaṃ anuvadati, puttopi pitaraṃ anuvadati, bhātāpi bhātaraṃ anuvadati, bhātāpi bhaginiṃ anuvadati, bhaginīpi bhātaraṃ anuvadati, sahāyopi sahāyaṃ anuvadati—
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.9.eng: A mother accuses her offspring; an offspring their mother; a father his offspring; an offspring their father; a brother his brother; a brother his sister; a sister her brother; a friend their friend—

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.10.eng: this is an accusation that isn’t also a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.11.eng: How’s there a legal issue that isn’t also an accusation?

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.12.eng: A legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute—

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.13.eng: this is a legal issue that isn’t also an accusation.

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.14.eng: How’s there a legal issue that’s also an accusation?

pli-tv-kd14:14.13.15.eng: A legal issue arising from an accusation is a legal issue and also an accusation.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.0.eng: Relationship between offenses and legal issues

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.1.pli: Āpatti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, āpatti no adhikaraṇaṃ, adhikaraṇaṃ no āpatti, adhikaraṇañceva āpatti ca.
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.1.eng: “Are there offenses that are also legal issues arising from an offense? Are there offenses that aren’t also legal issues? Are there legal issues that aren’t also offenses? Are there legal issues that are also offenses?

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.2.pli: Siyā āpatti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, siyā āpatti no adhikaraṇaṃ, siyā adhikaraṇaṃ no āpatti, siyā adhikaraṇañceva āpatti ca.
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.2.eng: There are offenses that are also legal issues arising from an offense. There are offenses that aren’t also legal issues. There are legal issues that aren’t also offenses. There are legal issues that are also offenses.

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.3.eng: How’s there an offense that’s also a legal issue arising from an offense?

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.4.pli: Pañcapi āpattikkhandhā āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, sattapi āpattikkhandhā āpattādhikaraṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.4.eng: There’s a legal issue arising from an offense because of the five classes of offenses, and there’s a legal issue arising from an offense because of the seven classes of offenses—

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.5.eng: this is an offense that’s also a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.6.eng: How’s there an offense that isn’t also a legal issue?

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.8.eng: this is an attainment/offense that isn’t also a legal issue.
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.8.comm: In the Pali, the word āpatti/samāpatti means both “attainment” and “offense”. The Pali is a play on words, which is impossible to replicate in English.

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.9.eng: How’s there a legal issue that isn’t also an offense?

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.10.eng: A legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation—

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.11.eng: this is a legal issue that isn’t also an offense.

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.12.eng: How’s there a legal issue that’s also an offense?

pli-tv-kd14:14.14.13.eng: A legal issue arising from an offense is a legal issue and also an offense.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.0.eng: Relationship between business and legal issues

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.1.pli: Kiccaṃ kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, kiccaṃ no adhikaraṇaṃ, adhikaraṇaṃ no kiccaṃ, adhikaraṇañceva kiccañca.
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.1.eng: “Is there business that’s also a legal issue arising from business? Is there business that isn’t also a legal issue? Are there legal issues that aren’t also business? Are there legal issues that are also business?

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.2.pli: Siyā kiccaṃ kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, siyā kiccaṃ no adhikaraṇaṃ, siyā adhikaraṇaṃ no kiccaṃ, siyā adhikaraṇañceva kiccañca.
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.2.eng: There’s business that’s also a legal issue arising from business. There’s business that’s not a legal issue. There are legal issues that aren’t also business. There are legal issues that are also business.

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.3.eng: How’s there business that’s also a legal issue arising from business?

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.4.pli: Yā saṅghassa kiccayatā, karaṇīyatā, apalokanakammaṃ, ñattikammaṃ, ñattidutiyakammaṃ, ñatticatutthakammaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.4.eng: Whatever is the duty or the business of the Sangha—a legal procedure consisting of getting permission, a legal procedure consisting of one motion, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.5.eng: this is business that’s also a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.6.eng: How’s there business that isn’t also a legal issue?

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.7.eng: The duty to teacher, the duty to a preceptor, the duty to a co-student, the duty to a co-pupil—

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.8.eng: this is business that isn’t also a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.9.eng: How’s there a legal issue that isn’t also business?

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.10.eng: A legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense—

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.11.eng: this is a legal issue that isn’t also business.

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.12.eng: How’s there a legal issue that’s also business?

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.13.eng: A legal issue arising from business is a legal issue and also business.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.15.14.0.1.eng: 9. The resolution and settling of legal issues

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.1.eng: “There are two principles for settling a legal issue arising from a dispute:

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.3.pli: Siyā vivādādhikaraṇaṃ ekaṃ samathaṃ anāgamma yebhuyyasikaṃ, ekena samathena sameyya—
pli-tv-kd14:14.16.3.eng: Is it possible that a legal issue arising from a dispute should be settled not by majority decision,

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.7.eng: It may be, monks, that monks are disputing, saying,

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.8.pli: dhammoti vā adhammoti vā, vinayoti vā avinayoti vā, bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti vā abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti vā, āciṇṇaṃ tathāgatenāti vā anāciṇṇaṃ tathāgatenāti vā, paññattaṃ tathāgatenāti vā apaññattaṃ tathāgatenāti vā, āpattīti vā anāpattīti vā, lahukā āpattīti vā garukā āpattīti vā, sāvasesā āpattīti vā anavasesā āpattīti vā, duṭṭhullā āpattīti vā aduṭṭhullā āpattīti vā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.16.8.eng: ‘This is the Teaching’, ‘This is contrary to the Teaching’, ‘This is the Monastic Law’, ‘This is contrary to the Monastic Law’, ‘This was spoken by the Buddha’, ‘This wasn’t spoken by the Buddha’, ‘This was practiced by the Buddha’, ‘This wasn’t practiced by the Buddha’, ‘This was laid down by the Buddha’, ‘This wasn’t laid down by the Buddha’, ‘This is an offense’, ‘This isn’t an offense’, ‘This is a light offense’, ‘This is a heavy offense’, ‘This is a curable offense’, ‘This is an incurable offense’, ‘This is a grave offense’, or ‘This is a minor offense.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.9.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.16.9.eng: If those monks are able to resolve that legal issue, this is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.13.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned.

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.14.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.15.pli: Yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā na paṭikkosanti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.16.15.eng: the monks who should be present have arrived, consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision.

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.17.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Teaching and the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.18.pli: Yena dhammena yena vinayena yena satthusāsanena taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasammati—
pli-tv-kd14:14.16.18.eng: the Teaching, the Monastic Law, the Teacher’s instruction—that by which that legal issue is resolved.

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.20.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the persons concerned:

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.21.pli: Yo ca vivadati, yena ca vivadati, ubho atthapaccatthikā sammukhībhūtā honti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.16.21.eng: both sides—those who are disputing and those they’re disputing with—are present.

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.23.pli: Evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ kārako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd14:14.16.23.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if any of the participants reopen it, they incur an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.16.24.eng: If anyone who gave their consent criticizes the resolution, they incur an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-kd14:14.17.1.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ tasmiṃ āvāse vūpasametuṃ, tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi, yasmiṃ āvāse sambahulā bhikkhū, so āvāso gantabbo.
pli-tv-kd14:14.17.1.eng: If those monks are unable to resolve that legal issue in that monastery, they should go to another monastery that has a number of monks.

pli-tv-kd14:14.17.2.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū taṃ āvāsaṃ gacchantā antarāmagge sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.17.2.eng: If they’re able to resolve that legal issue while on their way, this is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.17.6.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned.

pli-tv-kd14:14.17.8.pli: Yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā na paṭikkosanti—

pli-tv-kd14:14.17.11.pli: Yena dhammena yena vinayena yena satthusāsanena taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasammati—

pli-tv-kd14:14.17.14.pli: Yo ca vivadati, yena ca vivadati, ubho atthapaccatthikā sammukhībhūtā honti—

pli-tv-kd14:14.17.16.pli: Evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ kārako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd14:14.17.16.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if any of the participants reopen it, they incur an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.17.17.eng: If anyone who gave their consent criticizes the resolution, they incur an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.1.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū taṃ āvāsaṃ āgacchantā antarāmagge na sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ, tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi, taṃ āvāsaṃ gantvā āvāsikā bhikkhū evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.1.eng: If those monks are unable to resolve that legal issue while on their way, they should go to that other monastery and say to the resident monks,

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.2.pli: ‘idaṃ kho, āvuso, adhikaraṇaṃ evaṃ jātaṃ, evaṃ samuppannaṃ;
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.2.eng: ‘This legal issue has come about in such-and-such a way.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.3.pli: sādhāyasmantā imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamentu dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena, yathayidaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ suvūpasantaṃ assā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.3.eng: Please resolve it, venerables, according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, so that this legal issue may be properly disposed of.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.4.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, āvāsikā bhikkhū vuḍḍhatarā honti, āgantukā bhikkhū navakatarā, tehi, bhikkhave, āvāsikehi bhikkhūhi āgantukā bhikkhū evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.4.eng: If the resident monks are senior to the newly-arrived monks, the resident monks should say,

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.5.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe, āyasmanto, muhuttaṃ ekamantaṃ hotha, yāva mayaṃ mantemā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.5.eng: ‘Now, venerables, please go to one side for a moment while we discuss this matter.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.6.pli: Sace pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikā bhikkhū navakatarā honti, āgantukā bhikkhū vuḍḍhatarā, tehi, bhikkhave, āvāsikehi bhikkhūhi āgantukā bhikkhū evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.6.eng: If the newly-arrived monks are senior to the resident monks, the resident monks should say,

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.7.pli: ‘tena hi tumhe, āyasmanto, muhuttaṃ idheva tāva hotha, yāva mayaṃ mantemā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.7.eng: ‘Well then, venerables, please wait right here for a moment while we discuss this matter.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.8.pli: Sace pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ mantayamānānaṃ evaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.8.eng: If, while discussing that matter, the resident monks think,

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.9.pli: ‘na mayaṃ sakkoma imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanenā’ti, na taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ āvāsikehi bhikkhūhi sampaṭicchitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.9.eng: ‘We’re unable to resolve this legal issue according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction,’ then they shouldn’t take on that legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.10.pli: Sace pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ mantayamānānaṃ evaṃ hoti—

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.11.pli: ‘sakkoma mayaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanenā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.11.eng: ‘We’re able to resolve this legal issue according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction,’

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.12.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, āvāsikehi bhikkhūhi āgantukā bhikkhū evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.12.eng: then they should say to the newly-arrived monks,

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.13.pli: ‘sace tumhe, āyasmanto, amhākaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ yathājātaṃ yathāsamuppannaṃ ārocessatha, yathā ca mayaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamessāma dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena tathā suvūpasantaṃ bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.13.eng: ‘If you’ll tell us how this legal issue came about, we’ll be able to dispose of it properly according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.14.eng: And so we’ll take it on.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.15.pli: No ce tumhe, āyasmanto, amhākaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ yathājātaṃ yathāsamuppannaṃ ārocessatha, yathā ca mayaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamessāma dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena tathā na suvūpasantaṃ bhavissati, na mayaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ sampaṭicchissāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.15.eng: If, however, you won’t tell us, we won’t be able to properly dispose of it. And so we won’t take it on.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.16.pli: Evaṃ supariggahitaṃ kho, bhikkhave, katvā āvāsikehi bhikkhūhi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ sampaṭicchitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.16.eng: Having properly examined it like this, the resident monks should take it on.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.17.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, āgantukehi bhikkhūhi āvāsikā bhikkhū evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.17.eng: The newly-arrived monks should say this to the resident monks,

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.18.pli: ‘yathājātaṃ yathāsamuppannaṃ mayaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ āyasmantānaṃ ārocessāma.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.18.eng: ‘We’ll tell you how this legal issue came about.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.19.pli: Sace āyasmantā sakkonti ettakena vā ettakena vā antarena imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena tathā suvūpasantaṃ bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.19.eng: If you’re able to dispose of it properly by such and such means—according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction—
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.19.comm: Sp-ṭ 4.230: Antarenāti kāraṇena, “Antarena: by means of”.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.20.pli: Evaṃ mayaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ āyasmantānaṃ niyyādessāma.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.20.eng: then we’ll hand it over to you.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.21.pli: No ce āyasmantā sakkonti ettakena vā ettakena vā antarena imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena tathā na suvūpasantaṃ bhavissati, na mayaṃ imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ āyasmantānaṃ niyyādessāma.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.21.eng: If you’re unable to properly dispose of it  by such and such means, then we won’t hand it over to you.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.22.eng: We’ll take responsibility for it ourselves.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.23.pli: Evaṃ supariggahitaṃ kho, bhikkhave, katvā āgantukehi bhikkhūhi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ niyyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.23.eng: Having properly examined it like this, the newly-arrived monks should hand it over to the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.24.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.24.eng: If those monks are able to resolve that legal issue, this is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.28.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned. …

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.29.pli: evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ kārako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.29.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if any of the participants reopen it, they incur an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.30.eng: If anyone who gave their consent criticizes the resolution, they incur an offense entailing confession.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.1.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi tasmiṃ adhikaraṇe vinicchiyamāne anantāni ceva bhassāni jāyanti, na cekassa bhāsitassa attho viññāyati, anujānāmi, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ubbāhikāya vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.1.eng: “If, monks, while they’re discussing that legal issue, there’s endless talk, but not a single statement that’s clear, then they should resolve that legal issue by means of a committee.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.2.eng: A monk who has ten qualities may be appointed to that committee:

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.3.pli: sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.3.eng: One who’s virtuous and restrained by the Monastic Code. His conduct is good, he associates with the right people, and he sees danger in minor faults. He undertakes and trains in the training rules.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.4.pli: bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti, tathārūpassa dhammā bahussutā honti, dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā;
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.4.eng: One who has learned much, and who retains and accumulates what he has learned. Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, that have a true goal and are well articulated, and that set out the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—he has learned many such teachings, retained them in mind, recited them verbally, mentally investigated them, and penetrated them well by view.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.5.pli: ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso;
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.5.eng: One who has properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail; who has analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, and investigated them well, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.6.pli: vinaye kho pana ṭhito hoti asaṃhīro;
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.6.eng: One who is firmly committed to the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.7.pli: paṭibalo hoti ubho atthapaccatthike assāsetuṃ saññāpetuṃ nijjhāpetuṃ pekkhetuṃ pasādetuṃ;
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.7.eng: One who is capable of making both sides relax, of persuading them, of convincing them, of making them see, of reconciling them.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.8.eng: One who is knowledgeable about the arising and resolution of legal issues.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.10.eng: One who understands the arising of legal issues.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.11.eng: One who understands the ending of legal issues.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.12.eng: One who understands the way to the ending of legal issues.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.13.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imehi dasahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ bhikkhuṃ ubbāhikāya sammannituṃ.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.1.eng: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.2.pli: Paṭhamaṃ bhikkhu yācitabbo, yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.20.2.eng: First a monk should be asked, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.4.pli: Amhākaṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe vinicchiyamāne anantāni ceva bhassāni jāyanti, na cekassa bhāsitassa attho viññāyati.
pli-tv-kd14:14.20.4.eng: While we were discussing this legal issue, there was endless talk, but not a single statement that was clear.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.5.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmañca itthannāmañca bhikkhuṃ sammanneyya ubbāhikāya imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.20.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to a committee to resolve this legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.7.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.8.pli: Amhākaṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe vinicchiyamāne anantāni ceva bhassāni jāyanti, na cekassa bhāsitassa attho viññāyati.
pli-tv-kd14:14.20.8.eng: While we were discussing this legal issue, there was endless talk, but not a single statement that was clear.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.9.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmañca itthannāmañca bhikkhuṃ sammannati ubbāhikāya imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.20.9.eng: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to a committee to resolve this legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.10.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa ca itthannāmassa ca bhikkhuno sammuti ubbāhikāya imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd14:14.20.10.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to a committee should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.11.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.12.pli: Sammato saṅghena itthannāmo ca itthannāmo ca bhikkhu ubbāhikāya imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.20.12.eng: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to a committee to resolve this legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.20.13.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.20.13.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.21.1.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ubbāhikāya vūpasametuṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.21.1.eng: If those monks are able to resolve that legal issue by committee, this is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.21.5.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Sangha: the monks who should be present have arrived, consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Teaching and the Monastic Law: the Teaching, the Monastic Law, the Teacher’s instruction—that by which that legal issue is resolved. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the persons concerned: both sides—those who are disputing and those they’re disputing with—are present.

pli-tv-kd14:14.21.6.pli: evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ kārako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.21.6.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if any of the participants reopen it, they incur an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.22.1.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi tasmiṃ adhikaraṇe vinicchiyamāne tatrāssa bhikkhu dhammakathiko, tassa neva suttaṃ āgataṃ hoti, no suttavibhaṅgo, so atthaṃ asallakkhento byañjanacchāyāya atthaṃ paṭibāhati, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena te bhikkhū ñāpetabbā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.22.1.eng: While those monks are discussing that legal issue, there may be a monk there who’s an expounder of the Teaching, but who doesn’t know the Monastic Code or its analysis. Not understanding the meaning, he obstructs it by obscuring it with the wording. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.22.2.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.22.3.eng: The monk so-and-so is an expounder of the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd14:14.22.4.pli: Imassa neva suttaṃ āgataṃ hoti, no suttavibhaṅgo.
pli-tv-kd14:14.22.4.eng: but doesn’t know the Monastic Code or its analysis.

pli-tv-kd14:14.22.5.pli: So atthaṃ asallakkhento byañjanacchāyāya atthaṃ paṭibāhati.
pli-tv-kd14:14.22.5.eng: Not understanding the meaning, he obstructs it by obscuring it with the wording.

pli-tv-kd14:14.22.6.pli: Yadāyasmantānaṃ pattakallaṃ, itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā avasesā imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasameyyāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.22.6.eng: If the venerables are ready, we should ask monk so-and-so to leave, with the remainder of us resolving this legal issue.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.22.7.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.22.7.eng: If, after that monk has left, those monks are able to resolve that legal issue, this is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.22.11.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned. …

pli-tv-kd14:14.22.12.pli: evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ kārako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.22.12.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if any of the participants reopen it, they incur an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.23.1.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi tasmiṃ adhikaraṇe vinicchiyamāne tatrāssa bhikkhu dhammakathiko, tassa suttañhi kho āgataṃ hoti, no suttavibhaṅgo, so atthaṃ asallakkhento byañjanacchāyāya atthaṃ paṭibāhati, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena te bhikkhū ñāpetabbā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.23.1.eng: While those monks are discussing that legal issue, there may be a monk there who’s an expounder of the Teaching. He knows the Monastic Code, but not its analysis. Not understanding the meaning, he obstructs it by obscuring it with the wording. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.23.2.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.23.3.eng: The monk so-and-so is an expounder of the Teaching.

pli-tv-kd14:14.23.4.pli: Imassa suttañhi kho āgataṃ hoti, no suttavibhaṅgo.
pli-tv-kd14:14.23.4.eng: He knows the Monastic Code, but not its analysis.

pli-tv-kd14:14.23.5.pli: So atthaṃ asallakkhento byañjanacchāyāya atthaṃ paṭibāhati.
pli-tv-kd14:14.23.5.eng: Not understanding the meaning, he obstructs it by obscuring it with the wording.

pli-tv-kd14:14.23.6.pli: Yadāyasmantānaṃ pattakallaṃ, itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā avasesā imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasameyyāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.23.6.eng: If the venerables are ready, we should ask monk so-and-so to leave, with the remainder of us resolving this legal issue.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.23.7.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.23.7.eng: If, after that monk has left, those monks are able to resolve that legal issue, this is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.23.11.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned. …

pli-tv-kd14:14.23.12.pli: evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ kārako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.23.12.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if any of the participants reopen it, they incur an offense entailing confession for the reopening.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.1.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ubbāhikāya vūpasametuṃ, tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ saṅghassa niyyādetabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.1.eng: “If, monks, those monks are unable to resolve that legal issue by committee, they should hand it over to the Sangha, saying,

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.2.pli: ‘na mayaṃ, bhante, sakkoma imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ubbāhikāya vūpasametuṃ, saṅghova imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametū’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.2.eng: ‘Venerables, we’re unable to resolve this legal issue by committee. Can the Sangha please resolve it.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.3.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ yebhuyyasikāya vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.3.eng: I allow such a legal issue to be resolved by majority decision.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.4.eng: A monk who has five qualities should be appointed as the manager of the vote:

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.5.pli: yo na chandāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na dosāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na mohāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na bhayāgatiṃ gaccheyya, gahitāgahitañca jāneyya …pe…
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.5.eng: one who isn’t biased by favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear, and who knows who has and who hasn’t voted.
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.5.comm: “Who knows who has and who hasn’t voted” renders gahitāgahitañca jāneyya, literally, “He should know taken and not taken.” The taking refers to the taking of ballots, salāka.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.6.eng: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.7.pli: Paṭhamaṃ bhikkhu yācitabbo, yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.7.eng: First a monk should be asked, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.8.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ salākaggāhāpakaṃ sammanneyya.
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.9.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint monk so-and-so as the manager of the vote.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.11.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.12.eng: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as the manager of the vote.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.13.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno salākaggāhāpakassa sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.13.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as the manager of the vote should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.14.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.15.eng: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as the manager of the vote.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.16.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.16.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.17.eng: That monk should then distribute the ballots.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.18.pli: Yathā bahutarā bhikkhū dhammavādino vadanti tathā taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.18.eng: If the majority of monks vote in accordance with the Teaching, then that legal issue has been resolved.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.19.eng: This is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.21.eng: It’s been resolved face-to-face and by majority decision.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.23.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.24.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.25.pli: Yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā na paṭikkosanti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.25.eng: the monks who should be present have arrived, consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.27.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Teaching and the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.28.pli: Yena dhammena yena vinayena yena satthusāsanena taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasammati—
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.28.eng: the Teaching, the Monastic Law, the Teacher’s instruction—that by which that legal issue is resolved.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.30.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the persons concerned:

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.31.pli: Yo ca vivadati, yena ca vivadati, ubho atthapaccatthikā sammukhībhūtā honti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.31.eng: both sides—those who are disputing and those they’re disputing with—are present.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.33.eng: This is the meaning of by majority decision:

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.34.pli: Yā yebhuyyasikākammassa kiriyā karaṇaṃ upagamanaṃ ajjhupagamanaṃ adhivāsanā appaṭikkosanā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.34.eng: the doing of, the performing of, the participation in, the consent to, the agreement to, the non-objection to that legal procedure of majority decision.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.36.pli: Evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ kārako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.36.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if any of the participants reopen it, they incur an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.24.37.eng: If anyone who gave their consent criticizes the resolution, they incur an offense entailing confession.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyā evaṃ jātaṃ evaṃ samuppannaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.1.eng: At one time at Sāvatthī a legal issue had come about in this way.
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.1.comm: That is, it had come about in accordance with the immediately preceding discussion.

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.3.eng: who were dissatisfied with how the Sangha at Sāvatthī had resolved it.

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.4.pli: assosuṃ kho amukasmiṃ kira āvāse sambahulā therā viharanti bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā paṇḍitā viyattā medhāvino lajjino kukkuccakā sikkhākāmā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.4.eng: They heard that in a certain monastery there was a number of senior monks who were learned and masters of the tradition; who were experts on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; who were knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and were afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.5.pli: Te ce therā imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasameyyuṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena, evamidaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ suvūpasantaṃ assāti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.5.eng: They thought, “If these senior monks resolve this legal issue—according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction—then it will be properly disposed of.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū taṃ āvāsaṃ gantvā te there etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.6.eng: They then went to that monastery and said to those senior monks,

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.7.pli: “idaṃ, bhante, adhikaraṇaṃ evaṃ jātaṃ, evaṃ samuppannaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.7.eng: “This legal issue has come about like this.

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.8.pli: Sādhu, bhante, therā imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamentu dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena, yathayidaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ suvūpasantaṃ assā”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.8.eng: Venerables, please resolve it—according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction—so that it’ll be properly disposed of.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.10.pli: yathā sāvatthiyā saṅghena adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamitaṃ tathā suvūpasantanti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.10.eng: “This legal issue was properly disposed of by the Sangha at Sāvatthī,”

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.11.eng: and they resolved it in the same way.

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.13.pli: asantuṭṭhā sāvatthiyā saṅghassa adhikaraṇavūpasamanena, asantuṭṭhā sambahulānaṃ therānaṃ adhikaraṇavūpasamanena—
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.13.eng: were dissatisfied with how the Sangha at Sāvatthī had resolved that legal issue and also with how that number of senior monks had resolved it.

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.14.pli: assosuṃ kho amukasmiṃ kira āvāse tayo therā viharanti …pe…
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.14.eng: They then heard that in a certain monastery there were three senior monks …

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.16.pli: eko thero viharati bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.16.eng: one senior monk who was learned and a master of the tradition; who was an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; who was knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and was afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.17.pli: So ce thero imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasameyya dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena, evamidaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ suvūpasantaṃ assāti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.17.eng: They thought, “If this senior monk resolves this legal issue—according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction—then it will be properly disposed of.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.18.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū taṃ āvāsaṃ gantvā taṃ theraṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.18.eng: They then went to that monastery and said to that senior monk,

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.19.pli: “idaṃ, bhante, adhikaraṇaṃ evaṃ jātaṃ, evaṃ samuppannaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.19.eng: “This legal issue has come about in this way.

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.20.pli: Sādhu, bhante, thero imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametu dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena, yathayidaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ suvūpasantaṃ assā”ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.20.eng: Venerable, please resolve it—according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction—so that it will be properly disposed of.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.22.pli: yathā sāvatthiyā saṅghena adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamitaṃ, yathā sambahulehi therehi adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamitaṃ, yathā tīhi therehi adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamitaṃ, yathā dvīhi therehi adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamitaṃ, tathā suvūpasantanti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.22.eng: “This legal issue was properly disposed of by the Sangha at Sāvatthī, and likewise by that number of senior monks, by those three senior monks, and by those two senior monks,”

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.23.eng: and he disposed of it in the same way.

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.24.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū asantuṭṭhā sāvatthiyā saṅghassa adhikaraṇavūpasamanena, asantuṭṭhā sambahulānaṃ therānaṃ adhikaraṇavūpasamanena, asantuṭṭhā tiṇṇaṃ therānaṃ adhikaraṇavūpasamanena, asantuṭṭhā dvinnaṃ therānaṃ adhikaraṇavūpasamanena, asantuṭṭhā ekassa therassa adhikaraṇavūpasamanena, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd14:14.25.24.eng: Since those monks were dissatisfied with how all of these had disposed of that legal issue, they went to the Buddha and told him what had happened. … The Buddha said:

pli-tv-kd14:14.25.25.eng: “Monks, this legal issue has been settled, laid to rest, and properly disposed of.

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.1.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ saññattiyā tayo salākaggāhe—
pli-tv-kd14:14.26.1.eng: To persuade those monks, I allow three kinds of voting:

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.2.eng: a secret ballot, whispering in the ear, and an open vote.

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.4.pli: Tena salākaggāhāpakena bhikkhunā salākāyo vaṇṇāvaṇṇāyo katvā ekameko bhikkhu upasaṅkamitvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.26.4.eng: The manager of the vote should make ballots of two different colors, go up to the monks one by one and say,

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.5.eng: ‘This is the ballot for those who hold this view, and this is the ballot for those who hold that view.

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.7.eng: When anyone has taken a ballot, they should be told,

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.10.eng: those who speak contrary to the Teaching are in the majority, then the vote is invalid and to be postponed.

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.12.eng: those who speak in accordance with the Teaching are in the majority, then the vote is valid and to be announced.

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.13.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, gūḷhako salākaggāho hoti.

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.14.eng: What’s voting by whispering in the ear?

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.15.pli: Tena salākaggāhāpakena bhikkhunā ekamekassa bhikkhuno upakaṇṇake ārocetabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.26.15.eng: The manager of the vote should inform the monks one by one by whispering in the ear,

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.16.eng: ‘This is the ballot for those who hold this view, and this is the ballot for those who hold that view.

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.18.eng: When someone has taken a ballot, they should be told,

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.21.eng: those who speak contrary to the Teaching are in the majority, then the vote is invalid and to be postponed.

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.23.eng: those who speak in accordance with the Teaching are in the majority, then the vote is valid and to be announced.

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.24.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, sakaṇṇajappako salākaggāho hoti.

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.27.eng: those who speak in accordance with the Teaching are in the majority, the ballots should be distributed openly.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.26.28.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, vivaṭako salākaggāho hoti.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.2.eng: “There are four principles for settling a legal issue arising from an accusation:

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.3.pli: sammukhāvinayena ca, sativinayena ca, amūḷhavinayena ca, tassapāpiyasikāya ca.
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.3.eng: resolution face-to-face, resolution through recollection, resolution because of past insanity, and by further penalty.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.4.eng: Is it possible that a legal issue arising from an accusation should be settled

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.5.eng: not by resolution because of past insanity or by further penalty,

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.7.eng: by resolution face-to-face and by resolution through recollection?

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.10.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsenti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.10.eng: It may be that monks are groundlessly charging a monk with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.11.pli: Tassa kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno sativepullappattassa sativinayo dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.11.eng: If that monk has great clarity of memory, he’s to be granted resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.12.eng: And it should be granted like this.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.13.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā …pe…
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.13.eng: That monk should approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms,

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.15.eng: ‘Venerables, monks are groundlessly charging me with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.16.pli: Sohaṃ, bhante, sativepullappatto saṅghaṃ sativinayaṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.16.eng: Because of my great clarity of memory, I ask the Sangha for resolution through recollection.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.17.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.19.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.20.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.21.pli: Bhikkhū itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsenti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.21.eng: Monks are groundlessly charging monk so-and-so with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.22.eng: Because of his great clarity of memory, he’s asking the Sangha for resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.23.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno sativepullappattassa sativinayaṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.23.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should grant him resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.25.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.26.pli: Bhikkhū itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃsenti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.26.eng: Monks are groundlessly charging monk so-and-so with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.27.eng: Because of his great clarity of memory, he’s asking the Sangha for resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.28.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno sativepullappattassa sativinayaṃ deti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.28.eng: The Sangha grants him resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.29.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno sativepullappattassa sativinayassa dānaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.29.eng: Any monk who approves of granting him resolution through recollection should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.30.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.31.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.32.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.33.pli: Dinno saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno sativepullappattassa sativinayo.
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.33.eng: Because of his great clarity of memory, the Sangha has granted monk so-and-so resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.34.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.34.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.35.eng: This is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.37.eng: It’s been resolved by resolution face-to-face and by resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.39.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Sangha: the monks who should be present have arrived, consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Teaching and the Monastic Law: the Teaching, the Monastic Law, the Teacher’s instruction—that by which that legal issue is resolved.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.40.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the persons concerned:

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.41.pli: Yo ca anuvadati, yañca anuvadati, ubho sammukhībhūtā honti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.41.eng: both those who are accusing and those who have been accused are present.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.43.eng: This is the meaning of resolution through recollection:

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.44.pli: Yā sativinayassa kammassa kiriyā karaṇaṃ upagamanaṃ ajjhupagamanaṃ adhivāsanā appaṭikkosanā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.44.eng: the doing of, the performing of, the participation in, the consent to, the agreement to, the non-objection to that legal procedure of resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.46.pli: Evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ kārako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd14:14.27.46.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if any of the participants reopen it, they incur an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.27.47.eng: If anyone who gave their consent criticizes the resolution, they incur an offense entailing confession.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.28.1.eng: “Is it possible that a legal issue arising from an accusation should be settled

pli-tv-kd14:14.28.2.eng: not by resolution through recollection or by further penalty,

pli-tv-kd14:14.28.4.eng: by resolution face-to-face and by resolution because of past insanity?

pli-tv-kd14:14.28.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ummattako hoti cittavipariyāsakato.
pli-tv-kd14:14.28.7.eng: It may be that a monk is insane and suffering from psychosis.

pli-tv-kd14:14.28.8.pli: Tena ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ hoti bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.28.8.eng: Because of that, he does and says many things unworthy of a monastic.

pli-tv-kd14:14.28.9.pli: Taṃ bhikkhū ummattakena cittavipariyāsakatena ajjhāciṇṇena āpattiyā codenti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.28.9.eng: Monks accuse him of an offense, saying,

pli-tv-kd14:14.28.10.eng: ‘Venerable, do you remember committing such-and-such an offense?’

pli-tv-kd14:14.28.12.eng: ‘I was insane and suffering from psychosis.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.1.eng: “Is it possible that a legal issue arising from an accusation should be settled

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.2.eng: not by resolution through recollection or by resolution because of past insanity,

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.4.eng: by resolution face-to-face and by further penalty?

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ saṅghamajjhe garukāya āpattiyā codeti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.7.eng: It may be that a monk accuses a monk of an offense in the midst of the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.8.pli: ‘saratāyasmā evarūpiṃ garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitā, pārājikaṃ vā pārājikasāmantaṃ vā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.8.eng: ‘Venerable, do you remember committing such-and-such a heavy offense entailing expulsion or bordering on expulsion?’

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.10.pli: ‘na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, sarāmi evarūpiṃ garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitā, pārājikaṃ vā pārājikasāmantaṃ vā’ti.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.11.eng: As he tries to free himself, the accusing monk presses him further:

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.12.pli: ‘iṅghāyasmā sādhukameva jānāhi, yadi sarasi evarūpiṃ garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitā, pārājikaṃ vā pārājikasāmantaṃ vā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.12.eng: ‘Come on, venerable, try again to  remember whether you’ve committed such-and-such a heavy offense.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.14.pli: ‘na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, sarāmi evarūpiṃ garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitā, pārājikaṃ vā pārājikasāmantaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.14.eng: ‘I don’t remember committing such an offense,

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.15.pli: Sarāmi ca kho ahaṃ, āvuso, evarūpiṃ appamattikaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.15.eng: but I do remember committing such-and-such a minor offense.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.16.eng: As he tries to free himself, the accusing monk presses him further:

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.17.pli: ‘iṅghāyasmā sādhukameva jānāhi, yadi sarasi evarūpiṃ garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitā, pārājikaṃ vā pārājikasāmantaṃ vā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.17.eng: ‘Come on, venerable, try harder to  remember whether you’ve committed such-and-such a heavy offense.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.19.pli: ‘imañhi nāmāhaṃ, āvuso, appamattikaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvā apuṭṭho paṭijānissāmi.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.19.eng: ‘I’ve admitted that I’ve committed this minor offense without being asked.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.20.pli: Kiṃ panāhaṃ evarūpiṃ garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvā, pārājikaṃ vā pārājikasāmantaṃ vā, puṭṭho na paṭijānissāmī’ti?
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.20.eng: So when asked about a heavy offense, why wouldn’t I admit it?’

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.22.pli: ‘imañhi nāma tvaṃ, āvuso, appamattikaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvā apuṭṭho na paṭijānissasi.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.22.eng: ‘But you didn’t admit that you had committed this minor offense without being asked.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.23.pli: Kiṃ pana tvaṃ evarūpiṃ garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvā, pārājikaṃ vā pārājikasāmantaṃ vā, apuṭṭho paṭijānissasi?
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.23.eng: So when asked about a heavy offense, why would you admit it?

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.24.pli: Iṅghāyasmā sādhukameva jānāhi, yadi sarasi evarūpiṃ garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitā, pārājikaṃ vā pārājikasāmantaṃ vā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.24.eng: Come on, venerable, try harder to  remember whether you’ve committed such-and-such a heavy offense.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.26.pli: ‘sarāmi kho ahaṃ, āvuso, evarūpiṃ garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitā, pārājikaṃ vā pārājikasāmantaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.26.eng: ‘I remember committing such-and-such a heavy offense entailing expulsion or bordering on expulsion.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.27.pli: Davā me etaṃ vuttaṃ, ravā me etaṃ vuttaṃ—
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.27.eng: When I said that I didn’t remember, I spoke playfully, I spoke too fast.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.28.pli: nāhaṃ taṃ sarāmi evarūpiṃ garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitā, pārājikaṃ vā pārājikasāmantaṃ vā’ti.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.29.pli: Tassa kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.29.eng: They should do a legal procedure of further penalty against that monk.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.30.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.31.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.32.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.33.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe garukāya āpattiyā anuyuñjiyamāno avajānitvā paṭijānāti, paṭijānitvā avajānāti, aññenāññaṃ paṭicarati, sampajānamusā bhāsati.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.33.eng: The monk so-and-so, while being examined in the midst of the Sangha about a heavy offense, asserts things after denying them, denies things after asserting them, evades the issue, and lies.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.34.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tassapāpiyasikākammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.34.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do a legal procedure of further penalty against monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.36.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.37.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe garukāya āpattiyā anuyuñjiyamāno avajānitvā paṭijānāti, paṭijānitvā avajānāti, aññenāññaṃ paṭicarati, sampajānamusā bhāsati.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.37.eng: The monk so-and-so, while being examined in the midst of the Sangha about a heavy offense, asserts things after denying them, denies things after asserting them, evades the issue, and lies.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.38.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of further penalty against monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.39.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno tassapāpiyasikākammassa karaṇaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.39.eng: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of further penalty against monk so-and-so should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.40.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.41.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.42.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.43.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of further penalty against monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.44.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.44.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.45.eng: This is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.47.eng: It’s been resolved face-to-face and by further penalty.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.49.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Sangha: the monks who should be present have arrived, consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Teaching and the Monastic Law: the Teaching, the Monastic Law, the Teacher’s instruction—that by which that legal issue is resolved. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the persons concerned: both those who are accusing and those who have been accused are present.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.50.eng: This is the meaning of ‘by further penalty’:

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.51.pli: Yā tassapāpiyasikākammassa kiriyā karaṇaṃ upagamanaṃ ajjhupagamanaṃ adhivāsanā appaṭikkosanā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.51.eng: the doing of, the performing of, the participation in, the consent to, the agreement to, the non-objection to that legal procedure of further penalty.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.53.pli: Evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ kārako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd14:14.29.53.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if any of the participants reopen it, they incur an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.29.54.eng: If anyone who gave their consent criticizes the resolution, they incur an offense entailing confession.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.0.eng: Acting according to what has been admitted

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.2.eng: “There are three principles for settling a legal issue arising from an offense:

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.3.pli: sammukhāvinayena ca, paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-kd14:14.30.3.eng: resolution face-to-face, acting according to what’s been admitted, and covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.4.eng: Is it possible that a legal issue arising from an accusation should be settled

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.5.eng: not by covering over as if with grass,

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.6.eng: but by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what’s been admitted?

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.9.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu lahukaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.30.9.eng: It may be that a monk has committed a light offense.

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.10.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.30.10.eng: That monk should approach a single monk, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.16.eng: ‘You should restrain yourself in the future.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.17.eng: This is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.19.eng: It’s been resolved face-to-face and by acting according to what’s been admitted.

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.21.eng: Face-to-face with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Teaching and the Monastic Law: the Teaching, the Monastic Law, the Teacher’s instruction—that by which that legal issue is resolved.

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.22.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the persons concerned:

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.23.pli: Yo ca deseti, yassa ca deseti, ubho sammukhībhūtā honti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.30.23.eng: both the one who confesses and the one he confesses to are present.

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.25.eng: This is the meaning of acting according to what’s been admitted:

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.26.pli: Yā paṭiññātakaraṇassa kammassa kiriyā karaṇaṃ upagamanaṃ ajjhupagamanaṃ adhivāsanā appaṭikkosanā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.30.26.eng: the doing of, the performing of, the participation in, the consent to, the agreement to, the non-objection to that legal procedure of acting according to what’s been admitted.

pli-tv-kd14:14.30.28.pli: Evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ paṭiggāhako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.30.28.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if the receiver of the confession reopens it, he incurs an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.1.eng: If this is what happens, all’s well.

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.2.pli: No ce labhetha, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sambahule bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.31.2.eng: If not, that monk should approach several monks, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.5.pli: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena te bhikkhū ñāpetabbā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.31.5.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform those monks:

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.6.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.7.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu āpattiṃ sarati, vivarati, uttāniṃ karoti deseti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.31.7.eng: The monk so-and-so remembers an offense—he reveals it, makes it plain, and confesses it.

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.8.eng: If the venerables are ready, I’ll receive his confession.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.18.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the persons concerned:

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.19.pli: Yo ca deseti, yassa ca deseti, ubho sammukhībhūtā honti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.31.19.eng: both the one who confesses and the one he confesses to are present.

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.21.eng: This is the meaning of acting according to what’s been admitted:

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.22.pli: Yā paṭiññātakaraṇassa kammassa kiriyā karaṇaṃ upagamanaṃ ajjhupagamanaṃ adhivāsanā appaṭikkosanā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.31.22.eng: the doing of, the performing of, the participation in, the consent to, the agreement to, the non-objection to that legal procedure of acting according to what’s been admitted.

pli-tv-kd14:14.31.24.pli: Evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ paṭiggāhako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.31.24.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if the receiver of the confession reopens it, he incurs an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.32.1.eng: If this is what happens, all’s well.

pli-tv-kd14:14.32.2.pli: No ce labhetha, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.32.2.eng: If not, that monk should approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd14:14.32.7.eng: The monk so-and-so remembers an offense—he reveals it, makes it plain, and confesses it.

pli-tv-kd14:14.32.8.eng: If the Sangha is ready, I’ll receive his confession.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.32.17.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Sangha: the monks who should be present have arrived, consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Teaching and the Monastic Law: the Teaching, the Monastic Law, the Teacher’s instruction—that by which that legal issue is resolved. This is the meaning of face-to-face with the persons concerned: both the one who confesses and the one he confesses to are present.
