pli-tv-kd14:14.32.18.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if the receiver of the confession reopens it, he incurs an offense entailing confession for the reopening.

pli-tv-kd14:14.32.19.eng: If anyone who gave their consent criticizes the resolution, they incur an offense entailing confession.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.0.eng: Covering over as if with grass

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.1.eng: “Is it possible that a legal issue arising from an offense should be settled

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.2.eng: not by acting according to what’s been admitted,

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.3.eng: but by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass?

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ hoti bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.6.eng: It may be that monks who are arguing and disputing do and say many things unworthy of monastics.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.7.eng: If they consider this and think,

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.8.pli: ‘amhākaṃ kho bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.9.pli: Sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññamaññaṃ kāressāma, siyāpi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.9.eng: ‘If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism,’

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.10.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ tiṇavatthārakena vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.10.eng: then I allow you to resolve this legal issue by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.11.eng: And it should be resolved like this.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.12.pli: Sabbeheva ekajjhaṃ sannipatitabbaṃ, sannipatitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.12.eng: Everyone should gather in one place. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.13.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.14.pli: Amhākaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.14.eng: While we were arguing and disputing, we did and said many things unworthy of monastics.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.15.pli: Sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññamaññaṃ kāressāma, siyāpi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.15.eng: If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.16.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ tiṇavatthārakena vūpasameyya, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttanti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.16.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should resolve this legal issue by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.17.pli: Ekatopakkhikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena sako pakkho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.17.eng: The monks belonging to one side should be informed by a competent and capable monk belonging to their own side:

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.18.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.19.pli: Amhākaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.19.eng: While we were arguing and disputing, we did and said many things unworthy of monastics.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.20.pli: Sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññamaññaṃ kāressāma, siyāpi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.20.eng: If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.21.pli: Yadāyasmantānaṃ pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ yā ceva āyasmantānaṃ āpatti, yā ca attano āpatti, āyasmantānañceva atthāya, attano ca atthāya, saṅghamajjhe tiṇavatthārakena deseyyaṃ, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttan’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.21.eng: If the venerables are ready, then for your benefit and for my own, I’ll confess in the midst of the Sangha both your and my own offenses by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.22.pli: Athāparesaṃ ekatopakkhikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena sako pakkho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.22.eng: The monks belonging to the other side should be informed by a competent and capable monk belonging to their own side:

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.23.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.24.pli: Amhākaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.24.eng: While we were arguing and disputing, we did and said many things unworthy of monastics.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.25.pli: Sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññamaññaṃ kāressāma, siyāpi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.25.eng: If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.26.pli: Yadāyasmantānaṃ pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ yā ceva āyasmantānaṃ āpatti, yā ca attano āpatti, āyasmantānañceva atthāya, attano ca atthāya, saṅghamajjhe tiṇavatthārakena deseyyaṃ, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttan’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.26.eng: If the venerables are ready, then for your benefit and for my own, I’ll confess in the midst of the Sangha both your and my own offenses by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.27.pli: Athāparesaṃ ekatopakkhikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.27.eng: A competent and capable monk belonging to one side should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.27.comm: I here follow the PTS reading, ekatopakkhikānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, as opposed to the MS reading, athāparesaṁ ekatopakkhikānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ. With the MS reading there is no distinction between the two groups of monks. The PTS reading is supported by the reading in OPM.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.28.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.29.pli: Amhākaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.29.eng: While we were arguing and disputing, we did and said many things unworthy of monastics.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.30.pli: Sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññamaññaṃ kāressāma, siyāpi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.30.eng: If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.31.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ yā ceva imesaṃ āyasmantānaṃ āpatti, yā ca attano āpatti, imesañceva āyasmantānaṃ atthāya, attano ca atthāya, saṅghamajjhe tiṇavatthārakena deseyyaṃ, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.31.eng: If the Sangha is ready, then for the benefit of these venerables and myself, I’ll confess in the midst of the Sangha both their and my own offenses by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.33.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.34.pli: Amhākaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.34.eng: While we were arguing and disputing, we did and said many things unworthy of monastics.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.35.pli: Sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññamaññaṃ kāressāma, siyāpi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.35.eng: If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.36.pli: Ahaṃ yā ceva imesaṃ āyasmantānaṃ āpatti, yā ca attano āpatti, imesañceva āyasmantānaṃ atthāya, attano ca atthāya, saṅghamajjhe tiṇavatthārakena desemi, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.36.eng: For the benefit of these venerables and myself, I confess both their and my own offenses in the midst of the Sangha by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.37.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati amhākaṃ imāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ saṅghamajjhe tiṇavatthārakena desanā, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.37.eng: Any monk who approves of confessing our offenses in the midst of the Sangha by covering over as if with grass should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.38.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.39.pli: Desitā amhākaṃ imā āpattiyo saṅghamajjhe tiṇavatthārakena, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.39.eng: We have confessed our offenses in the midst of the Sangha by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.40.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.40.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.41.1.eng: A competent and capable monk belonging to the other side should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.41.2.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. While we were arguing and disputing, we did and said many things unworthy of monastics. If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism. If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, then for the benefit of these venerables and myself, I’ll confess in the midst of the Sangha both their and my own offenses by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders. This is the motion.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.41.3.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. While we were arguing and disputing, we did and said many things unworthy of monastics. If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism. For the benefit of these venerables and myself, I confess in the midst of the Sangha both their and my own offenses by covering over, as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders. Any monk who approves of confessing our offenses in the midst of the Sangha by covering over as if with grass should remain silent. Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.41.4.eng: We have confessed our offenses in the midst of the Sangha by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders. The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.43.eng: This is called the resolution of a legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.45.eng: It’s been resolved face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.47.eng: Face-to-face with the Sangha, the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the persons concerned.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.48.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.49.pli: Yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā, te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā na paṭikkosanti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.49.eng: the monks who should be present have arrived, consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.51.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the Teaching and the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.52.pli: Yena dhammena yena vinayena yena satthusāsanena taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasammati—
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.52.eng: the Teaching, the Monastic Law, the Teacher’s instruction—that by which that legal issue is resolved.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.54.eng: This is the meaning of face-to-face with the persons concerned:

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.55.pli: Yo ca deseti, yassa ca deseti, ubho sammukhībhūtā honti—
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.55.eng: both the one who confesses and the one he confesses to are present.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.55.comm: Here “the one he confesses to” should presumably be seen as the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.57.eng: This is the meaning of covering over as if with grass:

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.58.pli: Yā tiṇavatthārakassa kammassa kiriyā karaṇaṃ upagamanaṃ ajjhupagamanaṃ adhivāsanā appaṭikkosanā—
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.58.eng: the doing of, the performing of, the participation in, the consent to, the agreement to, the non-objection to that legal procedure of covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.60.pli: Evaṃ vūpasantañce, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇaṃ paṭiggāhako ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.60.eng: When a legal issue has been resolved like this, if a receiver of the confession reopens it, he incurs an offense entailing confession for the reopening.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.60.comm: Again, “a receiver” should presumably be understood as any member of the Sangha who is taking part in the legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd14:14.33.61.eng: If anyone who gave their consent criticizes the resolution, they incur an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-kd14:14.34.2.eng: There’s one way of settling a legal issue arising from business:

pli-tv-kd14:14.34.4.eng: The fourth chapter on the settling of legal issues is finished.
